Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: Cutlerallstar
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with our two children, 2 and 6 in a King Suite. Always welcomed by a warm and friendly staff. They even loaned us beach toys and chairs free of charge. Wasn't really bothered by the bar noise next door. My wife said that she didn't hear a thing in the room and I barely heard much on the pull out with our 6 year old. Not sure how you could get any more of a relaxing stay in the heart of PB. If you want peace and quiet and absolutely no activity you're better off staying at home. Pacific Beach has a lot going on and this location puts you close to it.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Park Inn= Party City”
Reviews.Author: Jopalis
Reviews.Content: I guess if you are staying here to be in the heart of all the activity, you will like it. Our family liked the location, however, live music from a location directly behind the hotel made it impossible to sleep until the bar closed. So...for our family it was a losing proposition. Hotel amenities were very acceptable but we had to get some sleep. We got them to move us to a quieter location but they charged us the upgrade. Never ever again would I stay there.

Reviews.Title: “"San Diego, On the Beach"”
Reviews.Author: flgetawaymom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March. The location is wonderful-right on the beach. Rooms were attractive, and the hotel was close to restaurants. The problems we encountered were with the room itself. We stayed in a King, Balcony View room. The bathroom was not cleaned well. There were hairs on the floor and some mildew. The next problem arose in the late afternoon. We heard the shower very loudly from the adjacent room. The adjacent bathroom must be directly behind the head board of the bed. When I called the front desk, I was told that people come off the beach and it should end soon. We went out for dinner and turned in for the night at 11pm. In the middle of the night approximately 2am, we were awakened by the sound of rushing water. This went on for 40 minutes! It was impossible to sleep. I have stayed in many hotels and motels and have never encountered water sound as loud as this establishment. The sound was loud enough to record on my iphone which I did play back for the front desk to hear. This was supposed to be more of an upscale hotel. I'm surprised they do not invest in sound insulation between the guest rooms. Fortunately, we were only booked for one night. It would have been nice if the font desk offered to change our room after our first noise complaint at 5pm, rather than shrug the complaint off and tell us to wait it out. It makes one wonder if their rooms other rooms have the same problem.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn B
Reviews.Content: The people who work this hotel work well as a team. They are friendly, helpful, efficient, and welcoming. The hotel was clean. The service superb! The help from the staff great! One of the best hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at OPI”
Reviews.Author: jpchaplin
Reviews.Content: We had wonderful stay. OPI is convienent to shops, restaurants and the beach. With the help from the front desk we used public transportation to go to downtown San Diego ( $5 person for all day usage). All of the staff at OPI could not have been more helpful and accommodating! Thank you for a wonderful stay and we will see you again!

Reviews.Title: “Im in Love with this Place!!! :) Awesome Staff..Sachin and Mat are the best!!”
Reviews.Author: ferniesky
Reviews.Content: Im in love with this Place !!! We had the same room every year we visit here.We had a nice King Bed with balcony view..The Staff are the best Sachin , Matt and the rest of the staff. will be back again in Apr. 2012 hoping we get the room again!!! ")

Reviews.Title: “Good location, adequate accomodation”
Reviews.Author: meijiqueen
Reviews.Content: Right on the beach, with a wonderful service staff, this venue is merely adequate, not luxury. No gym, no truly gracious environment, nice kid-depth pool and spa, good parking and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie L
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego for a Birthday getaway and was so excited to arrive to the Inn and see the various shops at a walking distance. The room was great it overlooked the pool and we had a perfect view of the ocean. Even though it rained we were so close to various different bars it was not a problem, we still enjoyed ourselves very much. The only reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5 was because they charge $10 a day for parking. Other than that the staff was firendly and the place was great!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Dhankston
Reviews.Content: Ocean Park Inn is our favorite place to stay when visiting San Diego. Last week was our second time staying there and the view was phenomenal. We got a chance to visit Sea World which is less than 5 minutes from the hotel. Will definitely stay there on the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary Trip at the Ocean Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: wlars
Reviews.Content: We visited San Diego for the first time this month, and weren't sure what part of the city that we wanted to stay in. We decided to stay on Pacific Beach to be on the water. We were NOT disappointed! This location is absolutely perfect, and is still within a short drive from the zoo, La Jolla, the Gaslamp District or just about anywhere you want to go! Great decision! Our room was on the 3rd floor overlooking the boardwalk. We originally booked the first floor, but was happy to pay the extra price to be higher and not look through the glass on the lower level. The front desk was extremely helpful with whatever we needed. Stay at the Ocean Park Inn! You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jennie Z
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a personable staff member who helped us upgrade our room to one with a view for only a few dollars more. This clean hotel had a very nice complimentary breakfast and the location was perfect--close to the beach and shopping. We will return for future visits to this same hotel and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Annika265
Reviews.Content: A very nice, cosy and clean hotel. The staff was the most friendly and serviceminded that you can find. You felt very welcome from the first minute. Perfect location close to the beach and easy to use the local buses to get to different places in San Diego. I really recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dan A
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the hotel. The staff was very helpful. The rooms were clean, the pool was warm. It was a great location right on the beach. I definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “WOUNDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: jeralyn f
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful king room facing the Pacific ocean. It was everything I had hoped for. Not to stuffy, although very clean, comfortable, beautiful views right from our room and friendly and professional staff. Parking was just $10.00 extra a night compared to other hotels was a deal. They had a salt water aquarium in the loby which was one of the best I've ever seen. O yes did I mention the comfy bed. There where good restaurants just around the corner. The beach was clean. I would love to visit again and will recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “What a value!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marian F
Reviews.Content: We took a chance by booking 2 nights at this hotel. We had never been to pacific beach. Ocean right outside our door. Clean hotel, with very friendly and helpful staff. Short walk to the pier for spectacular sunsets. Safe underground parking. Small extras like newspaper and fresh fruit throughout the day. Firehouse Grill next door was loud, but we just joined in the fun and had a blast.(we are seniors). We returned the next day for a delicious lunch-good prices, too. We look forward to our next trip to the Ocean Park Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Fix”
Reviews.Author: johnsue62510
Reviews.Content: Can't be much closer to the ocean, listening to the waves as you sleep. Price is right, clean rooms with great parking. Only real flaw, new carpeting is needed. When booking request the quiet side or next time we would preferably book the rooms right on the boardwalk, worth the extra money. Great location for a lot less cost. Patrick was very friendly when we checked in. Went the extra for making our stay as great as possible.

Reviews.Title: “views are wonderful”
Reviews.Author: c b
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nites in Jan.2012, Booked 3 rooms.Rooms need new carpeting and baseboard trim.The property is clean and the underground parking is great.Seem to be consistant homeless people,but did not seem to be concerning issue for safety.For quiet sleep do not book room near Fire House Bar. Breakfast is good,could change it up every day or so. Front desk is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: burg415
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms, 4 nights, with another couple. Love this place!! Close to everything, super friendly staff. Breakfast is good, but agree a change every other day would be nice. This is 2nd time back, and will definitely be back soon. Breakfast & wifi included, $10 parking. Seems they are always doing maintenance, painting, etc., which shows they care. Sunsets are beautiful as well as the ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “What we were looking for.”
Reviews.Author: Wade C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ocean Park Inn Jan 2012 and really enjoyed it. We were there for leisure and really enjoyed everything it offered. The pool and hot tub were clean. The rooms were what we expected, clean and average sized. Breakfast was good with DIY waffles as well as the usual continental foods. The staff was friendly and helpful. Parking was a lot cheaper than the other places around, only $10/night. Overall it was what we were looking for. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,great beach and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: vidtrans
Reviews.Content: Overall a good hotel.A few things to watch out for. The insulation between the floors is not good.If you're lucky to get a third floor room avoid the ones facing the main street(three rowdy bars facing the rooms).They charge more for ocean view rooms. Breakfast is adequate but was the exact same for the four days we were there. The hotel is clean but certain areas look a little worn. The rooms have a fridge,microwave and a safe.The safe did not work a couple of times but it was taken care of within two minutes. The beach and surrounding area is quite nice.There are several homeless people in the area but it still seems safe with the usual precautions. If you want a hot shower I think you have to take it very early after that it's lukewarm.Parking is $10.00 /day.If you're going for a couple of days you could find spots on the street but be careful to read the signs well. The mattresses in our room were very soft.If you have a sensitive back and need a firm mattress you would have to ask if they have some. There's a big supermarket across the street which closes at 1:00 am. Be sure to visit the La Jolla cove for incredible views.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beach side hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diganta S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place during the Christmas this year and I must say I enjoyed it. It's right in front of the ocean and even with a partial view room - you would love to see the ocean waves from your balcony. The hotel is close to utility shops, groceries, ATMs and restaurants (services I used) and the staff were happy to help us. I must mention Sachin, who helped us a lot during our stay - from getting restaurant coupons to getting toys for my 2 yr old son to play in the beach. The best part of his service is that you don't need to ask him for it, he's rather offer you service. There was a lemonade bottle in front of reception desk and I used it every time I passed the location. The morning complimentary breakfast was adequate. The swimming pool and the hot tub were well-maintained and we got pool towels whenever I asked for. The only downside of the hotel is that it is a bit dated looking. I also saw a few homeless people sitting around the beach but I didn't see them causing any problem to the tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Epic”
Reviews.Author: jimmy k
Reviews.Content: First of all, I travel a lot. I typically get a good feel of how the customer service is going to be from when I get to the front desk. This place fit that rule. I really like this place for many reasons: 1) you get the small business family feel when you check in. The front desk folks were especially helpful. its a great hotel because they want the business but they don't skimp out on service just because they know they are by the beach in a good location. They even cut me a discount when I mentioned yelp so that was a plus. 2) I know from traveling that often times there can be issues with your room or hotel. Its bound to happen. but the ocean park inn staff handled it with ease. I believe I spoke to mat(or matt? ) not sure, but he was incredibly helpful and apologetic. When I got to my room there was an issue with an issue with lights in the room and the problem was fixed immediately. No muss, no fuss, and they don't make you feel bad about asking to fix problems, which i've faced with previous hotels. Not to mention the location is amazing. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends... It's also a really family friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can do better down the beach”
Reviews.Author: Shelnian
Reviews.Content: Homeless men camp outside ocean view rooms from 6am to 10pm everyday and if you open your drapes to enjoy the view they just keep staring in. Internet is 54g and barely works. Can't Skype with it. No internet computer in lobby. Have to ask the front desk to perform air web check-in for you. Don't give you best available room if you use a discount even though they advertise they do. Breakfast helpers don't speak english and just knit in ajoining room and aren't helpful at all. Fruit at front desk are old and not edible. Is a good location. Promo Code is gobblegobble. Their are better places to stay nearby.

Reviews.Title: “We love Ocean Park Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Ross4860
Reviews.Content: We've spent many long weekends in San Diego since my son was posted to the Navel base there in 1992. We stayed in a variety of places until we found Ocean Park Inn a few years ago. Now we only stay there. The location is perfect for us; we can park the car and relax. There are restaurants, a grocery store and a Catholic church all within easy walking distance, and getting to/from the airport is easy even for country folk driving in the big city! We prefer the ocean front rooms. When we're too lazy to do anything else, watching the activity on the boardwalk and the beach from our balcony is an attraction in itself. The pool/hot tub area is comfortable and inviting. Walking in from the ocean waves to the hot tub is sheer indulgence! Our most recent visit, in November 2011, was as enjoyable as always. The staff is super-friendly and helpful. Patrick offered not only to print our boarding passes but to deliver them to our room. The entire front desk staff made us feel like old friends back for a visit. While the room rates were higher this time, we noticed some nice upgrades like newer and more comfortable balcony and pool furniture and an expanded breakfast area. I'm already looking forward to our next trip to San Diego, and without question we'll stay at the Ocean Park Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Reneski
Reviews.Content: What a great spot: right on one of the nicest beaches around, wide boardwalk out front, the views are fabulous. Pacific Beach is a student area with a lively nightlife and plenty of restaurants, grocery store, pharmacy, liquor stores and transit near by. Hotel itself is looking a bit faded, but they are upgrading some of the rooms (can be noisy), the beds are good and the complimentary breakfast is fresh and plentiful. Ask for a west facing room to get ocean views. While not the most luxurious place around, this hotel is solid value for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for annual trip”
Reviews.Author: Cliff G
Reviews.Content: I lived in San Diego from 2000 - 2004 and since I have left I return every year for a 4 day boys trip. Having lived there I knew exactly where I wanted to stay with my friends. The hotel has an awesome location and tremendous personnel. The rooms are extremely comfortable, the ocean views are fantastic, the pool area is great and the hotel has tremendous value for your vacation dollar. We will be going to this same awesome hotel every year for our annual trip. I have two million flown miles and typically do not care for hotels regardless of one star or five. However, this is the perfect location in the middle of paradise. You won't be disappointed. Cliff Gardner

Reviews.Title: “Lovely relaxing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: offroadinaj
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice, and both times the accomodations contributed to an excellent vacation! Nothing super fancy, but the location is great! Rooms are clean, and decent sized. comfy beds, and a nicer than normal continental breakfast included. Great view from any room, and close enough to walk to many restaurants and beach walk right outside. Love the reef aquarium in lobby!

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: kittykisses
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, great view, great location, great pool. great staff. Next to tons of restaurants and a bike ride to the amusement park. Had a blast! The front desk even checked us in online for our flight! Also the free breakfast has lots of options. Would definately stay at this privately owned property again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and even better staff!”
Reviews.Author: moneret
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Park Inn for four nights at the end of our California road trip. The positives: -Super helpful front desk staff, particularly Sachin and Patrick -Location - right on the beach and boardwalk -Rooms had fridge, microwave and safe -Beach chairs, boogie boards, beach towels available at no extra cost -Great value - free internet, continental breakfast and $10 secured parking -Good sized room -Close to Ralph's grocery store Overall view: This is an older property on the beach. If you are looking for shiny bells and whistles and modern decor, do not stay here. If you want a place where you can relax, enjoy the beach, and feel welcome by the amazing front desk staff, then this is the place to be. Sachin and Patrick were truly welcoming and went the extra mile to make sure our visit to San Diego was a good one. Definitely pay for an ocean front room as it is much quieter. The east side is right beside a very loud nightclub, which is packed from Thurs- Sat. I would not have been happy if I was on that side. Overall, we loved our stay here - the location, view and staff could not be beat. Area notes - get the fish taco from Pacific Beach Club!

Reviews.Title: “best stay will return”
Reviews.Author: nicole s
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a prime location. It was very clean and nice. The staff was very pleasant and helpful and helped us get around town. They recommended places to visit and where not to go. Very friendly people. The hotel is located right on the ocean front, it is surrounded by bars and night clubs. There is always something to do around the hotel. The hotel parking garage is small with limited parking and tight spaces, but was sufficient. This was our honeymoon. They made it a memorable experience especially for a first time visit. I will defeintely return.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: bigred0007
Reviews.Content: This is our families fourth time to the Ocean Park and probably our last. Stayed for seven nights.It is a good place to stay if you don't mind being woken up in the middle of the night by people partying in the hotel. Back to back nights we were woken up by the people in the next room partying. Loud music, yelling and screaming on their balcony and in the hallway. They even invited people back to their room after the bars closed for extra loudness. Office staff were not very accomodating at all. Offered us another room at a higher price or we could move to a room with no view for same price as we were paying for a view room.They did eventually did move us to another room after agruing with the staff and threatening to leave. We felt as though the hotel staff were accomodating the partiers not us. This used to be a family hotel. Not anymore. I will miss the location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Becky089
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights on the second floor (King with balcony view) and were very satisfied. The room was clean, breakfast ample, and view unbelievable! It's ideal for walking, jogging, playing on the beach and close to transportation for Old Town, Downtown, La Jolla, etc. We enjoyed the Ocean Park Inn and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable, clean; Will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: skylinewest
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel bc of its location right at the beach. Last year we stayed at Pacific Terrace, just down the street, but they raised their prices too high so this year we picked Ocean Park. I found OPI to be just great. The location is PERFECT if you want to go to the beach. Its also within walking distance to many different restaurants and shops. The beds and pillows were comfortable. The room was very clean, bathroom was clean too. The breakfast was good as well. Wifi is s-l-o-w but thats the only negative thing I can think of. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: Abby P
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Ocean Park Inn, mostly because of their prime location. I had a problem with them as soon as I left. I was there this year for my wedding anniversary. I was married in San Diego and I had worn a white sundress to my wedding. I brought that sundress and another dress my husband had given me as an anniversary gift with me. I accidentally left them in the room (completely my fault) and by the time I had realized it, I was three hours into my drive home back to Arizona. I called the hotel as soon as I arrived home, so at this point I had been checked out less than 24 hours. I explained to the front desk the dresses I had left, along with my room number. They called me back about 30 minutes later to say they did not locate the dresses. I asked to speak to the housekeeper who cleaned our room after we checked out as well as the housekeeping manager. They refused to allow me to speak to them, which pretty much tells me that their housekeeping policy is to take what is not theirs. I called several times in the next week and each time no one allowed me to speak to the housekeeping manager or the manager of the hotel. I am upset with myself for forgetting these dresses, but I am very upset that Ocean Park Inn apparently does not allow people to discuss issues with their management. Clearly they are hiding that someone took my dresses and do not want to speak to me about it. I urge anyone who goes here to not leave any valuables in their room for any period of time because apparently their housekeeping staff has sticky fingers and the management turns the other cheek.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: wanderercf
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in PB, right on the water but walking distance to shops and restaurants. Bus stop right on next corner for non-drivers. It is so worth getting a room with a balcony - waking up and falling asleep to the sound of the ocean is amazing! (Yes, even the noise from the Firehouse lounge across the street can be drowned out by the Pacific!) Room is well-appointed, continental breakfast is great, front desk is helpful, pool and hot tub clean and well maintained. My first stay was over a holiday weekend, and the people next door returned to their room late and began to blast music - the front desk responded immediately. I've returned once already, and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great for trip with infant!”
Reviews.Author: cyberchic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Thursday and Friday night with our 3-month old. The room was fantastic! Our balcony was right on the PB boardwalk, so when the baby was sleeping, we could sit out there and feel like we were on the beach. We spent both nights people-watching! We all slept great with the blackout curtains, king bed, and hotel-provided crib. The sound of the ocean waves also probably helped! The hotel had all the amenities we expected, including a microwave and refrigerator in the room, a sofa and seating area, free Wi-Fi, and free breakfast. The breakfast was standard continental hotel fare, but that was fine with us. The heated pool and hot tub were excellent. From the time we pulled into the driveway until we checked out, the front desk staff were all very friendly and helpful. They even provided a beach umbrella and beach toys. The hotel is also perfectly situated for walks along the boardwalk or into town for shopping. We spent almost the entire time just wandering around PB, checking out the shops and interesting beach houses. Would definitely recommend staying here if you want a somewhat affordable beachfront hotel in PB.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great people”
Reviews.Author: don m
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th vacation spent at Ocean Park Inn. We return because of the great value and great location, right on the beach! And of course the staff - we are always made to feel like friends, not just paying customers. We are frequently asked if there is anything they can do to make our stay better. It's not a 'giant chain hotel', really is an INN.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: FlyGuy47
Reviews.Content: I've been staying in the Pacific Beach area fairly regularly for a number of years and have defaulted to staying at the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge a couple of blocks away. However, the B.W. has gone downhill and really is in need of a refurbishment. Last time I was there, the telephone didn't work and the front desk and security guy were of absolutely no help in trying to get me a phone that would work (also never offered to let me switch rooms or give me a discount off the price of the room. So, I ran across the Ocean Park Inn and the rate was similar to the B.W. so I thought I'd give it a try. What a wonderful surprise! The place has clearly been renovated more recently than the B.W. (though they should fix up the elevator and elevator lobby from the garage - first impressions are important). Clean, too. Patrick at the front desk was great. All in all, stay here unless you're willing to pay $200 plus at some of the other upscale places down the road.

Reviews.Title: “weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: flyinghigh262
Reviews.Content: i knew i didn't have to worry to find a place to stay in PB for the night. front desk service was friendly and took care of what you needed. thanks to alexandra and the rest of the staff. registration...check inn and chilling out at the pool next to the walkway on PB was awesome. i would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: 1MoreTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure recently of staying at the Ocean Park Inn on a girls trip. We originally had two ocean view balcony rooms, but at the eleventh hour realized that was more room than we needed, so we were able to switch to their Two Queen Suite. This room accommodated our group of five nicely. We thought we'd be pretty crowded in it, but that wasn't the case at all. The bedroom with the two queens was quite spacious, and the couch in the living room pulled out to a queen sleeper, also with plenty of space to maneuver around it. We liked having a dinning table and the kitchenette was a nice touch with large plastic tumblers for our cocktails and Fiestawear(!) for our nightly snack spread. If I was going to find something to nitpick, the carpeting felt a bit icky under bare feet and the balcony was smaller than the rooms around us. Customer service was perfect and accommodating, the pool area was tops, and a continental breakfast saved us every morning while we got our act together to go eat somewhere. Being that you're smack in the heart of PB, it can be a bit noisy but you're probably not choosing this hotel for a peaceful and quiet experience. With that said, we didn't have any noise issues when trying to sleep at night... definitely would recommend the Ocean Park Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family vacation”
Reviews.Author: BeachLover50131
Reviews.Content: Great location on expanse of beach that's as nice as del Coronado. Our ocean-view room's balcony had nice view of beach & pier. Older hotel is well-maintained with great staff. Room with 2 Q beds was large enough for my husband, me, and our 20-yr old daughter for a relaxing week. 3 nice, deep dresser drawers to unpack. In addition to beach, easy walk to beach bars for casual dinner and to a yogurt shop. Convenient location for drives to Sea World, zoo, Safari Park, La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Every Minute of Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sk602
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days the end of Sept...Had an ocean front king room. We really enjoyed the view from our balcony and people watching. At night we would open the sliding glass doors and go to sleep listening to the ocean. We were pleased that the it wasn't as noisy from people on the boardwalk as we had expected although I imagine Aug would be noisier. Security patroled the area so we felt safe. Parking was $10 a night which is a bargain for that area.High speed Internet was free and we never had any problems with it. Continental Breakfast was the usual but okay. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jmnNy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Ocean Park Inn for 2 nights. We are traveling the California coast and this was our first stop. The hotel is not fancy but is in a great location on Pacific Beach. The rooms are clean and the hotel is steps from the beach and bars and restaurants on Pacific beach. We had lunch at Kono's - great place for a burger an people watching. The Zoo is a must when visiting San Diego and we spent the whole day there. Prado's in Balboa Park is a beautiful spot for dinner - great food. I highly recommend the Paella. The Zoo is about 15-20 min. from the hotel. Overall, this was a great location for our San Diego stay. If you are looking for a fancy hotel stay at Coronado.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Middle of Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Peak879
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Ocean Park Inn with 3 of my girlfriends. Room 201 was perfect! View of the ocean, pier and pool. This hotel is right in the middle of everything. I highly recommend renting a bike. We never felt like we needed a car once. The front desk staff is amazing and they have lots of discounts for all the nice restaurants. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for!”
Reviews.Author: endlessopportunities
Reviews.Content: Thank you to the Ocean Park Inn staff for everything you did to help make San Diego a great experience for us. We stayed for 4 nights in a partial ocean view room which was great for us because we were never in the room but nice to be able to go out and have coffee on the balcony in the morning and see the ocean. The hotel is located right next to the lifeguard station on the beach and also the firestation on grand ave. The fire station didn't bother us one bit, never heard them at all. There is also the "firehouse" which is a bar/club/restaurant which seemed to be busy all the time at night with loud music but never heard it all from our room! The front desk staff is very informative and nice! We never rented a car so the public transportation system was our friend by the end of the trip. $5.00 for an all day bus pass wasn't a bad deal if you had the time to go from point A to point B and sometimes C,D,E! The front desk staff were always more than happy to print off directions with the bus stops and bus numbers, Thank you Rachel, Sachin, Patrick and Mat, you ALL rock! The hotel is right on the ocean and steps from a very popular area for surfers. The beach is nice sand and clean. Hotel very centrally located in PB. One last thing, make sure to go to the Shore Club for their grilled Mahi Mahi tacos, they are voted best fish tacos in PB for a reason, AMAZING! Shore Club is literally 100 feet from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location right on beach and boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: MeraldaSue
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel located right on the boardwalk and beach on Pacific Beach- it's perfect if you are going for the beach!. It is located at the lifeguard station and has direct access to the beach when you walk outside. The beaches here are long and sandy- you can swim, watch surfers and just have the perfect beach day. They offer underground parking for 10/day. It is close to restaurants and the staff is ready with recommendations and coupons for local places. The area is great for walking, people watching and watching the sunset. The hotel itself is just your typical hotel- nothing fancy but you can't beat sitting on the small balcony and hearing the ocean. Our room did have a fridge and microwave, and the breakfast that is included is pretty basic but sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “All Smiles....”
Reviews.Author: Mary J
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best places I have stayed at in Pacific Beach. The friendly staff (to name a few Rachel and Sachin) made it easy for me to store my things until my room was ready. Plenty of great places to eat and go dancing!! Really great location if you plan to just walk or ride a bike during your stay. I had a great stay and plan to come back next year. Thanks again, OPI

Reviews.Title: “one word ;; great ;; best hotel on the ocean front”
Reviews.Author: kenneth s
Reviews.Content: my wife and i went to ocean park inn on sept 6 and 7, 2011. we had a balcony view room. it was the best time we ever had. the front desk people were fantastic esp. alexandra, thanks for your kindness and getting us in the room early the day we arrived from tucson. we were able to spend the afternoon on the ocean and all the next day. i was born on the ocean back east after we moved to tucson we both miss the ocean. the hotel was clean, easy to get around and plenty eating places. thanks again for making our vacation one of the best. i would recomend your place to everyone.. see you next sept. ... also all the rooms have been remodaled ... we try to get back there every year.

Reviews.Title: “No Place Like OPI”
Reviews.Author: BostonRae
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at OPI and I love it more each time I stay. You will be hard pressed to find a place this close to the beach, for this price, with these amenities and with a staff this fantastic. Patrick and Sachin at the front dest are awesome! You won't find two nicer guys who are always willing to help you with anything you need. After getting to my room, Patrick called me to be sure I liked the room and if there was anything that I needed. He has always been great at suggesting excellent places to eat in the area too. I had some people visiting for just a few hours over Labor Day weekend and there was absolutely no place to park anywhere in Pacific Beach - Sachin made sure that there was a spot for them at the hotel when they got there. How awesome is that? These guys are the best!!! All of the staff ave very accommodating and nice, but these guys are "the bomb"! They usually have coupons for discounts at various places in the area so ask them - they will be glad to help you out. Parking is $10.00 a nite in their own underground parking garage. Spaces are somewhat small, so larger vehicles may have a bit of a tight fit. Considering that on the weekends, and any holiday, parking in the area is nonexistent, this is a great plus to have available at this price. It is also gated so that you can feel secure when coming or going. The hotel is right on the Boardwalk which is a constant flurry of activity. Be it people walking, jogging, on roller blades, skate boards or bicycles. If you like people watching, you will have plenty of that here. The boardwalk extends for 3 miles all the way to South Mission Beach. There are many shops, restaraunts, bars, rentals and snack shops along the way. (check out the Fish Tacos at the Pacific Beach Shore club right next to the hotel!) Views from the Ocean view rooms are breathtaking to say the least. At sunset everyone along the boardwalk stops what they are doing, and watches as the sun goes down. Each balcony has a small table and 2 chairs making it a perfect cozy place to relax and just chill watching the people or the sunset. As one guest mentioned here, the water pressure in the shower is fantastic - something you don't often find in hotels. There's lots of counter space and the bathroom is roomy compared to many hotels often cramped bathrooms. People have mentioned the homeless that tend to hang out on the boardwalk near the hotel. I spend quite a bit of time walking around the boardwalk and sometimes standing near them and have never, ever been approached or ever felt threatened in any way (I am a single female). This year in fact, there were less than previous years and police presense was higher than any other year (perhaps because it was Labor Day Weekend?) I would not even consider the homeless as a factor in not choosing this hotel. The "Beach Flies" are quite harmless. As mentioned by others here, there is a nice flat panel TV, small microwave and mini fridge in the room. The beds are a bit soft for my taste and I'm not sure that they have changed since I started staying here, but I did not have a problem getting a good nite's sleep. Listening to the waves crash onto the beach is quite soothing! Love sleeping with the sliding glass door open. I love, love, love the Ocean Park Inn and can't wait to return next year. I have never found any negatives when it comes to this property. This is an excellent hotel and you will love your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here 5 times in 6 years for a reason”
Reviews.Author: KaptainKool
Reviews.Content: This is my wife and my favorite hotel. We love SD and this hotel has no frills but a location that can't be beat. This review for an overall 5 is because of the excelent views. I've written a review on this hotel before but not since the remodel. The rooms and hotel are very clean. Get a full ocean view room to get the spectacular effect of the beach and ocean. And best of all enjoy the beautiful so-cal sunsets. The hotel is centrally located within walking distance to restaurants and bars. The rooms are remodeled with a new flat screen tv (like you would ever want to watch tv). The staff is very friendly. If you want a deal get on their newletter and they run pretty good deals. We will be back to San Diego and we will stay at Ocean Park Inn. AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “We thought this hotel was fantastic and we will be going back!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly O
Reviews.Content: The hospitality was the best we have ever experienced, even better than our stays at the world famous "Hotel Del"! We will definitely be back and will tell our friends and family to stay here as well. The hotel is very clean and has a great geographic location! The staff was amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: CruisingCactus
Reviews.Content: This was our second Labor Day family stay (stayed 2010 also) and our third stay at this hotel. We rented two balcony â€“ ocean view rooms for 3 nights. We hope to have the family there again next Labor Day. PROS: Extremely clean â€“ the staff must take pride in their facility as all common areas, even the underground garage, are very clean. Pool, hot tub, even the fish tank are crystal clear. The desk staff couldnâ€™t be any nicer or helpful. We requested the same rooms if possible, and they made it happen. Location, the hotel is on the strand\beach. No smoking is allowed â€“ not only in the hotel but also the entire property so all you smell is the ocean air when on the balcony and maybe some fine food from the close by restaurants. We had two adjacent rooms on the third floor with a view of the strand, ocean and pier. Gated parking is available under the hotel â€“ very secure and convenient to keep beach chairs, umbrellas, etc. Free WiFi and excellent cell service. Continental breakfast was fine with pastries, bagels, juices, cereal, fruit, make your own waffles, etc. CONS: Canâ€™t think of any. We will stay there again. â€¢ Stayed September 2011, traveled with family

Reviews.Title: “memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: belmont5
Reviews.Content: Great view! great location! we usually stay at the Blue sea Lodge,which is very nice,but this hotel is in a better location with a better view. Absolutely the best Hotel in Pacific Beach!

Reviews.Title: “We always stay at Ocean Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: apryl b
Reviews.Content: Every time we are in San Diego we stay at the Ocean Park Inn. It is right on the beach. It is clean.The beds are comfortable. The rooms are a good size. We stayed in an ocean front. There is nothing better then waking up to the sound of the ocean. Each room has a small patio with table and chairs. They offer a continental breakfast; which is nicely done. The front desk staff, maintenance, housekeepers are all friendly and helpful. The location is great! So many restaurants within walking distance. For you foodies try The French Gourmet; 1.2 miles walk. Also it's nice they have a parking garage that is a $10 charge per night. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beach front view!”
Reviews.Author: empty002
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Ocean Park. We got a beach front view, and it was worth the extra cost for us. I like this hotel because the location is great. There are tons of places to eat and explore that you can walk to. Most San Diego attractions are a 15-20 minute car ride. The parking garage at the hotel also works out well because during busy season parking can be hard to find. The breakfast at the hotel is good and the fresh waffles are a plus. The pool and hot tub are clean and offer a nice view of the boardwalk. The reception staff at the Ocean Park are wonderful at providing information about good restaurants and attractions. They often have coupons or special information about dining options. I would definetly consult them if you need any suggestions. There are few hotels that compare to this one, so consider it for your next stay. The website sometimes offers special deals. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the beach; great view!”
Reviews.Author: Rasmus H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ocean Park Inn for the weekend of Comic Con in San Diego. During this period, it is very difficult to find a hotel - especially in downtown - and indeed, this hotel is a bit of a journey from the convention center. Unfortunately, all hotels (including this one) hike up their rates considerably during Comic Con which, I guess, is understandable. Supply and demand. Anyway, I had a great room at the hotel with an amazing view of the pool and the beach and ocean. What a beautiful view! A nice touch was the lovely balcony. When I ordered, I selected one of the rooms with a "partial ocean view", but I had pretty much a full ocean view. The room was fairly big and very clean and comfortable. Great amenities, including a fridge (which could be quite noisy at night - a bit of a downside when it was placed close to the bed) and tea/coffee making facilities which, funnily, were placed in the bathroom! One thing that may annoy some guests is the fact that the hotel is located directly opposite a noisy nightclub type place called The Firehouse which blasted loud music all night (possibly only during the weekend). Indeed, the area is populated with a lot of young folks going out to party, so if you're looking for a quiet time, this may not be the best location. The hotel is very close to the beach and the boardwalk with a lot of restaurants and shops. There's also a bus closeby to Oldtown from where you can get to all the major attractions in San Diego (including the convention center). The hotel is a relatively short drive from Sea World. With the rate you get free wi-fi and a complimentary breakfast - which was surprisingly good, with some nice selections. Great hotel, great service and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly hotel totally beachfront”
Reviews.Author: KatzFBA
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of Pacific Beach the Ocean Park Inn is hallmarked by the relaxed friendliness of it's staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them, from recommending (and more importantly NOT recommending) local eateries to working out driving itineraries. Star of the show was Sachin Mehta - he's been mentioned on TA before and deservedly so. The do-it-yourself waffles at breakfast was a real novelty for us too! Perhaps $350 a night is slightly on the high side for an hotel with no bar or restaurant and a no more than OK pool area but service like this made it feel like good value.

Reviews.Title: “We always come back to Ocean Park Inn!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmg1935
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 55th Wedding Anniversary at the beach at our very favorite Pacific Beach Hotel, Ocean Park Inn. We have been guests at Ocean Park Inn since it opened at least 20+ years ago. The staff is so helpful and professional at the front desk, Todd, the hotel engineer runs a tight ship - you should see how clean the pool is everyday - and the housekeeping staff knows how to take care of you and your room - nothing ever is missed by the staff. We will always recommend OP Inn - great rooms and what a view of the Pacific!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Beach Front Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Propjock60
Reviews.Content: We got very lucky to find this wonderful hotel. The location is perfect, the rooms are spacious and clean, the staff is friendly and helpful, the breakfast is good! The hotel is moderately priced for the location and offers parking, a nice pool, walking distance to excellent restaurants (World Famous, & Green Flash), and short walk to beach and walking path. Some people complained about noise from the Firehouse Bar, but treat yourself to an ocean view or partial view and you won't have to worry about noise. As you can tell, I really liked this hotel and hope to visit again someday!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the Ocean Park Inn!”
Reviews.Author: mountainmama1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a brief (3 nights) stay at the Ocean Park Inn. We were very pleased with this hotel. Everything was clean and fresh- something you can't always count on when staying right on the beach. The breakfast was fine- just the usual waffle, fruit, breakfast breads, and cereal buffet, but there was plenty. We appreciated also having a coffeepot, fridge and microwave in the room. There's a 7/11 just a few steps away, and a grocery store right across the street. The food next door at The Firehouse was excellent! The pool was small, and noisy with kids, but it was still fine and the lounge chairs around the pool were nice. Thankfully, the staff was good about shutting the pool down right at 10:00 each night. I was especially pleased to find out they supply sand chairs and towels for their guests, though the towels are only thin bath-size towels...too bad they don't offer real beach towels for laying out on. It's easy to get anywhere from here by bus- the bus stop is not even a block away. The hotel was a bit expenive, but that goes without saying when staying on the beach in San Diego in July. We will definitely be back- with the kids and grandkids!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service that takes all worries out of vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle1209
Reviews.Content: Ocean park inn went above and beyond our expectations. We arrived 6 hours before check in and they offered to hold our luggage and to use any of their services until our room was ready. In addition, the staff at the front desk was extremely accommodating and friendly, even offering us their own beach umbrella to use for the day. Our room was perfectly located, overseeing the pool and beach, and you can't beat waking up and falling asleep to the ocean waves. The hotel was located within walking distance to restaurants, shopping, and public transportation to take you into downtown san Diego. Ocean park inn definitely made our stay unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location clean friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dandiham
Reviews.Content: Great location right on beach, close to down town San Diego within 10 minutes. Clean and friendly staff. Most rooms with view of ocean. Breakfast buffet included, lots of restaurants near by. Will Return

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: JimCayman
Reviews.Content: Check in and check was very easy...The guy at check in offered a lot of ideas of things to do in the area...The room was clean...the location was close to food, some shopping and right on the beach...a bit too cold for me to go to the beach...about 20 minutes from downtown where I had to attend a convention...close to sea world also...easy parking...simple breakfast... The only negative was that we heard some stomping feet of someone walking back and forth on the third floor... All in all good hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Graduation Celebration in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: DDTSarasota
Reviews.Content: My daughter graduated from the New School of Architecture and Design in San Diego, so we traveled from Florida to San Diego and stayed at the Ocean Park Inn for 3 nights. We had a lovely room with a balcony overlooking the ocean and pier. We enjoyed the fabulous location within walking distance to many restaurants, pubs and stores. We enjoyed the beautiful pool and hot tub with view of the ocean. Complimentary continental breakfast was very nice with bagels, waffles, cereals, pastries, fruit, coffee and juices. Free Wifi was a very nice addition to the hotel amenities. I loved the PB Shore Club just a block away for great Tacos, Cocktails and ocean view, we ate there twice! I would highly recommend this hotel. The front desk staff were always helpful and very friendly, it's nice to come into the lobby and always being greeted by a friendly face. The lobby has a large awesome Aquarium full of beautiful saltwater fish, I loved watching the clown fish swimming around the coral and sea foliage. Our stay at the Ocean Park Inn was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: KeriBu
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly as advertised. Located perfectly, no need to drive anywhere. Our partial ocean view suite included a bonus view of the pier. The room, lobby, stairwell, breakfast area were all very clean. The only drawback were the hobos that like to nap on the grassy area just outside the pool area. Maybe a change to decorative rock could solve that problem. Nice that the parking was secure also. The noise from neighboring establishments was very obvious when walking through hotel halls, but not at all once we were in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Only Good Things to Say”
Reviews.Author: Insatiable Nomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Park for 3 nigths to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. The hotel is conveniently located on Pacific Beach, close to shops and restaurants. We were notified before our arrival that there was a problem with our reservation. We had booked an ocean front room on the internet but due to an inventory problem there were no ocean front rooms available. We were upgraded to a junior suite. The balcony overlooked the pool and had a partial ocean view. We appreciated how the hotel handled this issue. We were pleasantly surprised at how quiet the hotel was. In spite of the partying that took place due to graduations, we never heard a sound in our room. The underground parking is handy and reasonably priced. We didn't care for the complimentary breakfast. The pool and hot tub are immaculately maintained and if you are being quiet then the hotel doesn't bother you at all if you want to sit in the hot tub a few minutes passed closing. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great ocean View”
Reviews.Author: JeffEmmons
Reviews.Content: Spent one day here before moving up the coast for our family Spring break trip. Sunset was great even on an overcast day. Plan on returning to stay longer for our next vacation. Staff were great. and thePacific Beach Ale House was rockin too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: NSerm
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the perfect location and accommodations! We had a beautiful room that overlooked the pool and ocean. It's right on the boardwalk, so within walking distance to everything (restaurants, grocery store, beach, etc.) They had a continental breakfast that started early and went until 10 I think. Perfect for waking up early, eating breakfast, going on a walk, and coming back for a late breakfast. :) The front desk super, Sachin, was very nice and was so friendly with anything we needed help with. Parking is so hard to find at Pacific Beach, and there was parking right below the hotel. We rented bikes next to the hotel and had a blast riding up and down the bike path. Plus, when the ocean breeze was too much, we could relax at the pool inside the glass barriers. We will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ditto!”
Reviews.Author: amydd
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to reiterate all the positive comments about the OPI. My daughter and I had a great 4-night stay - very comfortable all around and super friendly front desk staff. We had an oceanfront room on the 2nd floor which was perfect in terms of view and noise (mostly we just heard the ocean!). I would definitely recommend this place to others and hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “The beauty of the ocean at your doorstep.....”
Reviews.Author: pierlady1
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, on the beach, close to restaurants,local grocery, entertainment, boutique shopping,etc. A great place to stay for singles, couples, families with kids, or anyone who just wants to enjoy a beautiful view and relaxed lifestyle. Continental breakfast is included with your staff. Staff is very friendly and helpful. You will love it here as I did and want to return!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome”
Reviews.Author: atf55
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at numerous other places on Mission and Pacific beaches over the past 5 years while traveling to SD for business, including the OPI. I have stayed downtown and further North away from the city. I will continue to come back here for numerous reasons but the old saying about when in Rome says it all. Yes there's transients on the boardwalk in front of the hotel, but I stay at the Gaslamp Hilton and have to tell them no every time I walk down the road. At least the ones in front of the hotel leave you alone as the cops make frequent trips on the boardwalk to enforce your privacy. Yes there's a band on certain nights that play music late into the night. It's a beach atmosphere, Has anyone been to Miami or Cabo lately? I love sitting on my balcony with a few cold ones, listening to the music and watching the wide variety of people go by. Do they enforce the non Smoking rules. Yes they do and thats a huge reason I go there. i cant stand smoky rooms that all these guests love to say they didn't smoke in yet they'll stand on the balcony and light up, ignorant to the fact they bring it in with them which stinks up everything they touch. Funny I never got a bill for smoking. Keep enforcing this one for me! I called and spoke with the manager 3 years ago that I wanted to make the OPI my regular hotel on business and vacations which has resulted in a great rate and better treatment than I get at the best Hilton's. They treat you like family and check throughout to make sure I have what I need and everything is satisfactory. The place is always clean, the pool is spotless with nice furniture, The view is amazing and the parking is gated and secure which is nice when we get home late from an event. The rates are nothing more than you find at every other hotel that offers this amazing location without getting into the old cottages that are nearby, I have my family vacation already booked for June as I want them to enjoy everything OPI has to offer,

Reviews.Title: “LOVE,, LOVE, LOVE THE OCEAN PARK INN-PACIFIC BEACH”
Reviews.Author: lfoldesh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the Ocean Park Inn 4-7-11 to celebrate our 40th anniversary in the beach area. Our original room was nice enough however we were offered an upgrade for a room right on the boardwalk where all the action is with a beautiful ocean view off our balcony.We took it. The room was very clean and spacious with a microwave and refridgerator. We could open our door off the balcony and listen to the ocean waves 24/7. It's not an ultra modern hotel however very clean with elevators and the beds were very very comfortable. There is a jacuzzi and swimming pool surrounded by plexi glass to cut any winds, which was nice since the beach was a bit windy. They serve a continental breakfast with waffles and danish, juice, coffee, cereal, milk fruit etc. Pretty nice and free! But the staff there is outstanding. Sachin and Patrick at the desk were the best! We were always greeted with smiles and greetings. They were both very accomodating with our every need and didn't make you feel at all like a bother to them. We were offered beach chairs and towels when they heard we were off to the beach and suggested some great eating spots when we asked. I forgot my credit card at check out and Sachin biked 2 blocks to where we were eating to return it to me. I would recommend this hotel if you don't want the usual mediocre beach pad. It's in a great location. My only drawback was that you have to pay each day for the parking (it was convenient) and it was a bit of a walk to get to the beach front room we had from the elevator. (but was worth it) I can't stress how great the staff was. Made our anniversary very memorable. I would stay at the Ocean Park Inn again. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT !!”
Reviews.Author: ciucini
Reviews.Content: very good hotel with a great view of the ocean. good situation for san diego. happy that they had a laundry !! breakfast very good. parking and pool also great. we will come back!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect beach experience!”
Reviews.Author: Wombat516
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here while vacationing with my significant and was pleasantly surprised by the experience. We had a room with an excellent view overlooking the boardwalk and beach. It was great to sit out on the balcony and be able to enjoy the view and action down below. The hotel and room were clean and up-to-date. The bed was extremely comfortable with quality linens. The location was decent, located along the boardwalk with a number of restaurants, shops, and other hotels. Once we were there, we didn't have to drive anywhere since there was enough to keep us entertained close by. The only downside was that it was a bit noisy at night. There were a few people from the nearby bars yelling on the sidewalk, but fortunately it was brief and not late enough to wake us up. Also, the waves were much louder than we'd expected while trying to sleep, but that wasn't the fault of the hotel. Might be something to keep in mind if you are looking for a beach-front hotel. However, overall it was a fabulous experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay for anything you'd want to do in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: goaskdad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at OPI for a business trip and got one of the Ocean Front rooms. I'm very glad I did. Watching the sunset and hearing the ocean waves breaking right from the room was incredible, and walking the sand while watching dolphins in the evening was special. The continental breakfast each morning included fresh fruit, cereals, DIY Belgian waffles, pastries, bagels, muffins, juices, etc. and was excellent. The parking spaces are below the hotel, and most are too small for anything over a midsized vehicle, but it was nice to not have to waste time looking for a parking spot along the street somewhere (parking wasn't free, but was only $10/day if I recall correctly). I've read that some reviewers had problems with noise from an establishment next door, but neither I, nor a fellow traveler in a different ocean front room had any problems with noise at our rooms. That problem might be only with certain rooms (not ocean-facing). The staff was fantastic. I definitely recommend stopping by the front-desk if you have any questions at all (traffic/travel routes, local eateries, etc.). And the room itself was very clean and everything worked as it should (including the free wifi, a microwave, small dorm-sized fridge and nice-sized flat screen tv). Also, the pool and hot tub were both spotlessly clean and well-maintained. OPI seems like a good place to stay no matter what you're doing in the San Diego area. It's only about 20 minute drive to the Gaslamp/East Village/Old Town area, and about the same to the Torrey Pines area to the north. If you don't have a rental car and can't get away, you probably won't miss it, since you're literally on the beach and can walk to several good eats and shops, and there's also Belmont Park down the boardwalk (to the south) where they have carnival rides & a roller coaster. Lots of fun near OPI within walking distance. On my last day in San Diego, I took a later flight so I could find a place to go hiking and Torrey Pines SRA is just a short drive north of OPI. I was able to take advantage of those extra 4 hours in San Diego and am very glad I did. Nothing to complain about at all, and I look forward to staying at OPI again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute BEST service, rooms and location on Pacific Beach!”
Reviews.Author: dduren
Reviews.Content: First time to San Diego. After searching for many options in Pacific Beach (aka PB), Mission Beach and La Jolla, I realized I made a great decision once arriving at Ocean Park Inn. Greeted by friendly staff, I experienced easy check-in and was provided a pass to their underground, secure parking garage. A $10 value worth every penny -- parking is very limited on Pacific Beach. Staff was very professional, accommodating and very hospitable. In fact, each time I met them in the lobby they remembered my first name the entire week. Let's talk accommodations. In addition to being in the heart of Pacific Beach activity with great "beach front" restaurants, lots of healthy runners and being ON THE BEACH, the hotel rooms are extremely clean, good size and have incredible views. Although it was a little cool at night, I opened my sliding door to the view and sounds of the ocean. Sure, it has a little dated charm to it, but fixtures and furniture are all updated, nicely painted and kept in great working order. Although Ocean Park Inn isn't part of a major brand hotel chain (which are limited on Pacific Beach), they offer many of the same amenities. I would say it's similar to a beach front "Holiday Inn Express" or "Hilton Garden Inn". But I have to say, neither of these chains I've experienced had views like the Ocean Park Inn! Hot tub was hot. Pool was clean, lighted and modern. Pool towels laid out on wicker pool chairs each morning. From the pool area you constantly hear the roar of the waves onto the shore day and night. Location was great. Don't worry about being "too far" from the San Diego life. During non-rush hours, you're only 7 minutes from I-5 (aka "the 5"), only 15-20 minutes from downtown San Diego & airport to the South, and from LaJolla to the North. Even if it takes you a little longer with traffic, the stay at Ocean Park Inn is definitely worth it. If you're going to a beach city, you might as well stay on the beach. And the noticeably present San Diego police keep the place fairly quiet and safe. Unfortunately, there is a small population of homeless on PB and around the hotel area. Most of the time, they keep to themselves and do not bother anyone. In addition to the San Diego Police, the main PB Life Guard Station is 100 feet from the hotel. For 20-30's crowd there are a lot of night life options around the hotel. At times you can hear music, but it's faint. Although the 20-30's crowd is a good majority on PB, there is good presence of families and baby boomers walking and living in the area. My guess is that the family/younger crowd increases quite a bit in the summertime when the beaches really open up. Clientele in the hotel was a mix of all ages and families. Price was right on the mark for this hotel. I hesitate to say it was a great price for what you get in fear of Ocean Park Inn raising their rates. :-) But after researching almost 20 hotels in the area, I found this one to be the best price for the view, quality, safety, accommodations and service. Shhhhhhh, just don't tell the hotel management that. Ha. If I return to San Diego in the future, you can bet I'll be calling this hotel for reservations!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: chaos7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ocean Park in mid-February when he traveled with me for a 2-day training class I attended (and we extended our stay thru the weekend). It was laid-back and friendly from check-in to check-out. But that doesn't mean slacking. The beds were clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and went above and beyond when we asked for restaurant recommendations or help tracking down lost keys. And the location, especially for the price, can't be beat. Our room faced the ocean and there were several shops and wonderful restaurants in easy walking distance. Since my husband was hanging around the hotel during the day while I attended my class, he had no lack of entertainment...the location for people-watching deserves an A rating. This is not a place to stay if you want to be pampered but if you want a clean, comfortable place to stay in a fun, friendly, interesting location, you can't beat it. A co-worker also attended the training and stayed at the same hotel. We both feel we got lucky that our training happened to coincide with a 32,000 member conference that was occurring in San Diego at the same time because that mean we had to look beyond the immediate downtown (Gaslamp) training area for accommodations. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Extremely Clean, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: traveld0nna
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past weekend. The location is gorgeous and convenient. Just a few exits from the airport and you can walk out the back door right onto beautiful Pacific Beach. The pool and hot tub area were lovely. The nicely appointed breakfast includes waffles, pastries, cereal, bagels, fruit, coffee and juices. Places to rent surfboards and bikes, along with reasonably-priced restaurants and a Starbucks, are just outside. Regarding the noise from the club across the alley mentioned in a few other reviews, the only place you can hear it is in the rooms facing the club. We were in a side room with a nice partial ocean view from our balcony and couldn't hear anything at all. There are actually a few clubs in the vicinity, including this one, which make the entire area very high energy. Would be excellent for 20 and 30-somethings looking for a fun place to party and posed no problem at all for my family which included my husband, me and our 16 yo daughter. The rooms were incredibly clean and include a small refrigerator, coffeemaker and microwave. The staff was helpful and friendly. We got an excellent rate and were very comfortable throughout our entire stay. It was perfect for our quick holiday getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Noise--Never Again”
Reviews.Author: mark95831
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to this hotel for years. Unfortunately, right next door a club has opened that has an open air bar/dance floor/ rave that is right next to a major wing of this hotel. On Friday and Saturday nights the noise is louder than at any place I have ever stayed until 2am. If you value your sleep don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great ocean front hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTraveler98108
Reviews.Content: The hotel was right on the beach. Literally you walk out the back of the hotel and you are on the boardwalk. It is centrally located so you can walk to a variety of place and its not too far of a drive to La Jolla or downtown. Only bad thing and luckily our room was away from from the street side, was the bar next door. This must be one of the happening places for happy hour because there was loud music during that time and the weekends. Overall, the hotel was very good. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have a better setting!”
Reviews.Author: dce_irish
Reviews.Content: Took my wife here for her 40th birthday, and it couldn't have been nicer. 3rd floor ocean front room w/ balcony, could hear the waves at night, very convenient, & love the PB location. Only advice would be to pay for the oceanfront rooms, especially on weekends, as the music from the bar next door is pretty loud. Overall, a great experience, beautiful room, & fantastic service - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Deal, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: beangirl40
Reviews.Content: Last minute booking got us a $99 ground floor room facing the ocean. (thanks Pat!) Can't beat the location, free breakfast (even waffles!) and cheap underground parking. Staff was super helpful when we needed to find a place that was kid-friendly to watch the Steelers game :) Great mini vacation-we will be back! Bonus: In room fridge and microwave and the shampoo/conditioner were delicious. They smell like yummy orange creamsicles!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the beach”
Reviews.Author: elise429
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ocean Park Inn 12/3 - 12/9/2010. We loved the location right on the beach and walking distance to restaurants and shops. We had a king suite, which is like being in an apartment - very roomy. The room was a bit dated but very clean. The staff is great - always helpful and greeting you every time you come in or leave the hotel lobby. It was nice having breakfast included, the made-to-order waffles were yummy. The weather was a bit chilly so we only used the pool and spa once. People have talked about the noise from the nearby restaurants/bars but it wasn't too bad. Just Friday and Saturday night but it didn't bother us (and we were on the side street across from the bars. The ocean-facing rooms are less noisy) The parking garage was fine - no problems parking - easy access in and out. We enjoyed sunrise and sunset on the beach and walking to Crystal Pier - what a view! We are planning a return trip in a few months and will be staying at Ocean Park Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the staff treats you like family!”
Reviews.Author: dmwoodfill
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Park Inn is an awesome place to stay, you are right in the heart of night life and dining and right on the beach and boardwalk. I stay here very often for business and extend some of my trips to the weekend to take advantage of all the activities in the area from surfing to sports bars. The owner is always around making sure things look great and Sanchin and the rest of the staff are very helpful and make sure you have everything you need to need to enjoy your stay. This is my home away from home, and a great one at that.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: ATXMusicLover
Reviews.Content: I was on a bit of an adventure when I booked a spontaneous trip to CA for the weekend to catch some live music. This was my first trip to San Diego (and my first trip to CA since I was 6 yrs old!). A friend of mine recommended the Ocean Park Inn to me, and I am so glad she did. From the time I called to book my reservation until the time I left the hotel (24 hrs after arrival), I felt comfortable and happy with my decision to stay there. The front desk staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel could not have been any more convenient to the beach and local shopping areas. There is even a grocery store a block away. I felt like I was right at home (if only my home were right next to the beach!). The PB Shore Club (right next door) has the most AMAZING fish tacos I have ever had, and there were super cool and friendly people hanging out there. In less than 30 minutes, you can walk up the boardwalk to Mission Beach/La Jolla. Hopefully the weather will be a bit more conducive to some "fun in the sun" next time I go. I am definitely going back!!! Oh, the complimentary breakfast rocked too.... belgian waffles! Yum! Thanks for making this Texan feel so comfortable and welcomed. It meant a lot to me!

Reviews.Title: “Best service we have had in years!”
Reviews.Author: MollyCushing
Reviews.Content: Our family took a trip to San Diego for some relaxation and fun. When we arriving we HAD a hotel in another part of town and found quickly it was not the place for us with a five year old. We found the Ocean Park Inn on line and quickly packed an went across town. When we arrived the staff was amazing, knowledgable and helpful. We actually left a tip for Patrick, one of the front desk attendants, to thank him for his help making this a great visit. Our family travels all over the world and I can truly say that I have had the BEST service here at the the Ocean Park Inn! Sincerely, Molly Cushing and Family

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location! Yet, limitations”
Reviews.Author: DesertCutie
Reviews.Content: Overall - loved the top floor ocean front room --- to fall asleep to the ocean waves and wake up to the waves was awesome. I left my patio slightly open all night (I brought a patio/ventilating lock, though it probably wasn't needed, but I was alone afterall) and it was gorgeous! However...I was on the side of the building next to the loud dance club/bar and heard it ALL night. Plus the gaggle of homeless guys on the walkway was loud at times (but police came by and moved them). If I stay again (and I want to) I'd ask for an oceanfront on the other half of the building away from the bar. Went til about 2am, and was quite obnoxious on a Sat night...but...the waves were so loud it partially drowned out the noise. So - something to be cautious of. Parking was extremely convenient! I was able to keep my car there the whole next day before I drove out of San Diego, which was really nice. The rooms got a 3 for clean. At first glance they seem ok, however I travel so much for business I've learned to tear apart and inspect certain areas for certain critters (my room was clean of signs of those) -- but there were layers upon layers of dust everywhere behind the scenes. Months of not vac'ing or getting behind the cracks or furniture. However - the room view was so awesome I could overlook it. Bed was ok, I mean, it's not a Hilton resort, and I didn't wake up sore. I did wake up with the sunshine and waves, and ate a peaceful breakfast on my patio, then wandered to north Pacific Beach and Tourmaline Beach and found awesome colorful shells for jewelry, a whole sand dollar (3.5" in diameter!), lots of wins and epic fails watching the surfers, and some fossil hunting on the cliffs. Overall a wonderful experience, you do pay for the view here, but it's amazing and convenient. I'd spend 2 nights here next time, but again, as far away from the bar as I could.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, just perfect; we'll be back as soon as possible!”
Reviews.Author: pjinusa
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, in perfect location right on the boardwalk - bars/restaurants/shops and supermarket, all within walking distance. Polite, caring, helpful and friendly staff. Parking no problem, underneath the hotel. We left a few things behind in a drawer; I called them, and they shipped to us straight away. Excellent service!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, right on beach. Close to restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: everlasting_summer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location in PB, right on the beachfront. The room were nothing special, but were clean and comfortable. The pool area was fairly stark and concrete, but the spa was great after a long day out exploring. It was really easy to access everything we wanted to from this hotel and easily get to either cheap or upmarket eating areas. We hired bikes one afternoon and rode along the coast and spent another day visiting the main sites of the city. If i were going back to San Diego again i would probably consider staying in La Jolla (which was a really lovely suburb just up the coast), or even Bird Rock. Both these areas were a bit more upmarket. Coronado which was really nice as well. PB is well suited to people looking for nightlife. The continental breakfast was good at the Ocean Park Inn. Whilst we were there, we also looked at the Pacific Terrace Hotel which was lovely. The rooms there were more plush that the Ocean Inn and the pool area had a lovely tropical feel about it. It was only a few minutes walk up from Ocean Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: kenbug
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel right on beach/boardwark....clean, comfortable room/facilities, flat screen TV....hot tub and small pool on beach....continental breakfast with waffles/toast/cereal/juice/fruit included in price of room....extremely helpful/friendly staff....located in great neighborhood - very safe, plenty of restaurants/bars within 2 block radius, people are very friendly/laid back....small fridge/microwave included in room, 24 grocery store located across street.....hotel is on boardwalk along beach. Can walk/rent bikes/skateboard for several miles in either direction...beach is awesome, right on Pacific Ocean, awesome waves/surfing, very relaxing, excellent people watching or just read a book....also close driving distance to all San Diego attractions....highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Ocean Park Inn is a fabulous place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: juju2378
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Park Inn is an incredible find. My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. The rooms are clean and nicely arranged. We had a junior suite and our family of four was easily accomodated. The location right off the boardwalk and steps from the ocean cannot be topped. We went to the San Diego Zoo, Sea World and then drove to Disenyland. It is convienently located for sightseeing. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We HIGHLY recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Noise + Bait & Switch soured a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: PeytonPlace
Reviews.Content: Room 309 Bait and Switch We made reservations to stay at the Ocean Park Inn at least two months before our visit. We found a good rate online and were looking forward to our 4-night stay. When we arrived, we were assigned room 309. It was a corner room with a partial view of the ocean as advertised and a King size bed as requested. As the evening progressed, we became aware of the noise from the bar next door.
