The doors and windows to our assigned room were poorly fitted and did not come close to dampening the music and bar chatter coming from the bar. Close to 10 pm, we called the front desk and were advised the bars were open until 2 am. We requested to be placed in another room but were told every available room was an upgrade for which they would charge us. We told them we would give up the partial view, the balcony or any other upgrades and were still advised changing rooms would cost us at least $40 more per night. It was that or we would have to try and find another hotel. Without an alternative, we ended up taking the other room provided. It was not what we requested, much more expensive than planned, and a disappointing bait and switch experience, but quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The best place on the San Diego Beach”
Reviews.Author: jean-Quebec
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! After 7 trip to San Diego beach area; it was the best hotel. And the area is wonderful with great restaurants and bar. The room is perfect, and the pool and hottub were very clean and very beautiful. I reccomand to all people that are visiting San Diego. The boardwalk is just in front of the hotel, and for sure you will feel the life on the beach like people of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Spot on the Beach!”
Reviews.Author: veAzyE
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at OPI this past Labor Day Weekend, and had a blast. The staff was very courteous and helpful. King suite is spacious and worth the expense. The location cant be beat. The photo above is a view from the hotel. If you go be... sure to ask for Patrick...he's the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CruisingCactus
Reviews.Content: Rented two balcony â€“ ocean view rooms Labor Day weekend (3 nights). This was our second stay at this hotel. PROS: Location, the hotel is on the strand\beach, where Mission Beach ends and Pacific Beach begins. Easy to find â€“ take Grand Ave off of I-5; it dead ends at the hotel. The main Life Guard Station is just left in front of the hotel, which came in handy when granddaughter got sand in her eyes. The hotel is immaculately maintained and clean. No smoking is allowed â€“ not only in the hotel but also the entire property so all you smell is the ocean air when on the balcony. We had two adjacent rooms on the third floor with a view of the strand, ocean and pier. Easy walking distance to many fine restaurants and bars â€“ check at the front desk they offer good recommendations and are friendly and accommodating. A CVS, Starbucks and 24 hour Ralphâ€™s grocery store for beer, wine, snacks, etc. are just across the street. Gated parking is available under the hotel and accessed via your room key card â€“ very secure and convenient to keep beach chairs, umbrellas, lock up your bikes, etc. Rooms have a flat widescreen TV, WiFi access, refrigerator, microwave and electronic safe. Continental breakfast was fine with pastries, bagels, juices, cereal, fruit, make your own waffles, etc. It is not a discount hotel; a little pricey but with most things in life, you get what you pay for. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4jjw9ka22
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. It's a perfect size, very clean and quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool and hot tub were very clean. I saw the hot tub emptied and refilled at least every 2nd day. The boardwalk was great to be located on. Rent some bikes and you can ride for miles. The bars in the area are noisy (no surprise - every bar is noisy!) however once inside the hotel and in your room you couldn't hear a thing. Lots of shopping and places to eat within walking distance. My family and I would definitely return and I will recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING QUALITY AND VALUE OCEAN FRONT IN PACIFIC BEACH”
Reviews.Author: SaneInVegas
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to find an ocean front hotel that does not cost an arm and a leg and does not disappoint with it's failure to live up to the pictures on it's Web site. Well, the Ocean Park Inn does not disappoint. Have traveled there for years and this little gem of a beach front hotel always delivers in every category. The rooms really are ocean front, in the very center of the action in Pacific Beach. The place is spotless, the pool is small but delightful, righ down to the fancy wicker lounge chairs and towels laid out around the seating areas. The continental breakfast is adequate and the beds are comfy. This hotel sits right on the strand, where people watching is superb and there is easy access to all the restaurants and retail establishments up and down the beach. The pier is three blocks away, coffee houses abound and you can rent beach equipment right next door. Very convenient in every way. There is parking under the hotel for a small $10 fee...worth every penny in this busy each town. The hotel will give you beach chairs and other stuff for your day on the sand. There is even room service from the restaurant next door. Who could ask for more? Conveniently located between La Jolla and San Diego, this is a great place for touring around the area's many attractions. Mission Bay is next to Pacific Beach, Ocean Beach is on the other side of Mission Bay, Old Town is just up the highway, etc. We highly recommend this small hotel. It is all it claims to be...and the prices are very fair. We paid $159 a night, mid week, and our room was literally 50 steps to the sand.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: heathernalder
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Ocean Park Inn, on 8-9-10 to 8-11-10. When i called to confirm my reservations i spoke with (PAT) he told me he had no record of us being in the system.. i was very concerned and (PAT) told me he would call the travel agent and get things figured out.. (PAT) was very helpful in trying to figure out what happened..once everything was settled we flew in from Salt Lake City. when we pulled up to the hotel i couldn't believe how close it was to the beach.. you didn't have to walk but twenty feet and you were there. when we checked in we didn't have a room available right away.. (JESUS) helped us stow away our bags until we could check in. we checked out the boardwalk and beaches and they were fantastic.. you have access to restaurants and shops all in a walking distance. the beach was clean and there were clean facilities near by.. when we checked in our room, it was fabulous EXCEPTIONALLY CLEAN. when(PAT) came on shift. i made sure to tell him what a great help he was with my traveling needs. My friend and I that night had a great time sitting by the pool and we met the security guard (RALPH) he was very professional and very nice.. we can say we felt very well taken care of. (PAT) was there all three days we were and was very helpful along with (JESUS) in all of our needs.. BREAKFAST was very GOOD continental breakfast consist of waffles,muffins, fruit, bagels, yogurt and all the juices you wanted, it was very impressive.. this hotel was one of the BEST HOTELS i have ever stayed in. the staff was very professional and very FRIENDLY i couldn't say anything bad about this hotel it was by far the most impressive exceptional hotels..!!! thank you (PAT) for helping me and April with everything while we stayed there. Thank you JESUS for helping us too with everything.. and RALPH with the security so we felt SAFE.. I will recommend this hotel to others and we have already have talked about going next year at the same time to San Diego to stay in this exact hotel.. ITS MINUTES AWAY FROM THE AIRPORT..thank you thank you (PAT) for everything you are fabulous worker and i appreciate everything you did for me.... VERY PLEASED!!!! APRIL AND HEATHER FROM THE ROOM 115)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: yoyorules
Reviews.Content: The partial view that I had on the 2nd floor with a balcony was so wonderful!! I thought all of the staff were extremely friendly...thank you

Reviews.Title: “SPECTACULAR service of any hotels thus far EVER ...”
Reviews.Author: CiaoBella59
Reviews.Content: We've travelled all over - US and out of the country. We've stayed at Ocean Park Inn many times but they have definitely improved their service 110%. Since our plane landed early (8:30 am), they went above and beyond - extremely helpful in storing our luggage so we didn't have to cart around (2 teenagers with us) and gave us towels to enjoy the pool and/or beach just outside. They ensured we had a larger room (2 queens balcony view) as we had 2 older teens and had us checked in as soon as they could accommodate us. They even came out to find us to let us know our room was ready. We could not have asked for better customer service! We will continue to return as the view overlooking the pool AND the ocean is awesome with a balcony to sit and drink our coffee or step out the back and sit by the ocean watching the dolphins playing. Their continental breakfast consisted of the usual but added made to order waffles. So convenient located to everything no car was necessary. TRY IT, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Hotel: Location and Quality”
Reviews.Author: zarfinator
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our stay. Location could not have been better for beach, shopping, and restaurants. 5 mins away from Sea World! Hotel was recently renovated. Great pool area and great breakfasts! Make sure you ask the front desk for restaurant coupons. We decided to upgraded to an oceanfront room, well worth it....Mat at the front desk went out of his way to help us out multiple times. Overall great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Right on the ocean- excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: NorCalMichaelC
Reviews.Content: If you want to be right on Pacific Beach and understand sand will be part of your life for your stay, Ocean Park Inn is great. We had two rooms, one was a king with view of ocean/pool area and the other was two queens with very limited ocean view.Both rooms were clean and comfortable and had safes in the closets, mini refrigerators, microwaves and small coffee makers in the rooms. From check-in through checkout, the staff was very friendly, helpful and accommodating. Yes it's rather expensive, but you walk right onto the boardwalk which directly fronts the beach. We were furnished towels for the pool, spa and beach. The breakfast features do it yourself waffles, cereals, pastries, muffins, yogurts, fruit, juices, milk and coffee. The room with the two queens looked out over the alleyway and could get noisy at night. The Firehouse BAR & Grill next door really hops Friday - Sunday nights and can get quite noisy. The food at Firehouse was mediocre at best - a medium rare to go burger came extra well done and was ridiculously small. Cheesesteak sandwiches were okay.This is obviously a major hot spot and it's not for the food. The hotel is constantly maintained, just watch Todd doing cleaning and chemical balancing every morning on the pool and spa! There's outdoor showers when you enter in from the boardwalk to rinse off the major amounts of sand clinging to every part of your body. What a treat to boogie board for hours, be able to come rinse off all the stuff and then jump into the crystal clear pool and hot spa. (No wetsuits in pool please!). It's a high 3 star property. But it pays for itself in location, customer service and amenities. High speed internet is hit and miss, worked better in one room than the other and sometimes went in and out. The parking garage can be VERY cramped for anything larger than a compact car, but it seems very secure. I bought small 2-4 cup coffee filters and some ground coffee at Ralphs across the street; the coffee they furnish in-room is WAY to weak and tasteless for me as is the coffee at breakfast. Pacific Bean up the street from Crystal Pier has excellent coffee drinks and great people working there. Zocalo Reataurant in Old Town was fantastic. Coyote Cafe in Old Town is good for standard Mexican food. The crab nachos at Joes Crab Shack can feed two at lunch. We took the teenagers to Knotts Soak City, about a 1/2 hour drive Southeast, for a day. They loved it. Recommend Mondays, slowest day of the week. It got overcast and cold for Mom & Dad. The weather was the lowlight of our trip. Sunday it was two degrees warmer in San Francisco than San Diego!! But when the sun is out, Pacific Beach is wonderful. Don't forget to check out the sunsets. Say Hi to SloMo on the Boardwalk for us!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't honor offer!”
Reviews.Author: jilla25
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times in the past and always had a good experience. However, upon calling today to book a reservation, in response to an email offer for a $50 gift certificate at the Firehouse restaurant upon booking, I was told by the manager Vania, that they didn't honor the email because it was expected that you would call that day to book (I waited 2 weeks). I forwarded the email to her, and mentioned that there was no expiration date on it or any indication that they wouldn't honor the offer after a particular date, but they insisted that they would not honor it. I didn't make the reservation. I thought that was pretty unfair.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location with a great view!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer042
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Ocean Park was great! We got a partial view room on the 3rd floor and the view was perfect. The front desk staff were very helpful. The secured parking felt very secure. Overall, it was a great stay! We would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great place and management was awesome! (Sachin Mehta was a great help!”
Reviews.Author: LIONGAMES
Reviews.Content: We will stay there again with our skate team (Liongames)

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!!”
Reviews.Author: sunnybv
Reviews.Content: Would we come back to Ocean Park Inn...YOU BET! As in previous years the staff was extremely accomadating...especially David. We loved the fresh bagels, sweet rolls, etc. in the morning. Felt secure having our car in a garage, loved only being steps from the sand. Thanks everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Susi55Eagle_Id
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the Ocean Park Inn at Pacific Beach, Ca. Always a pleasure to get to stay right on the beach. This hotel is in the best location. You can walk all over to restaurants, shopping, bars, etc. The staff are all very professional and charming.... and super friendly! The rooms are clean and pleasant. I have been back twice now and will continue when I'm lucky enough to get back down to Cali.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise....great hotel/great staff.”
Reviews.Author: cisco1972
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked this hotel for 5 nights near the end of June. The price was very reasonable compared to other properties located directly on the beach. The location is fantastic....right in the middle of everything you could want, with lots of shops, grocery stores, restaurants, bike and surf rentals, etc. all within walking distance. The amenities are great if you are on a budget, including a decent size mini-fridge and microwave. The free continental breakfast has everything you could ask for, including industrial size belgian waffle makers. BTW...that loud beep (which could double for air raid siren) means you need to turn the waffle over! The room is comfortable and clean. We had an ocean view corner room on the third floor with a nice balcony. I forgot to ask about the king bed in advance, so we had a queen, but it was very comfortable and the linens used were nice and seemed upscale. There was also a great flat screen tv mounted on the wall, but there were so many activities, we didn't watch it much. The parking is priced reasonably at 10 dollars per day and is in a gated underground garage, so the security was good. One pleasant surprise was the staff. Everyone was very friendly and accomodating, and always smiled and asked how our stay was going. I proposed to my fiance during the trip and we asked the front desk to to take our picture in the lobby the day it happened. When we returned from dinner, we were surprised to find a note of congratulations along with a chilled bottle of champagne and two glasses, a very nice touch. On another day, we misplaced our Zoo tickets that we printed from home. The gentlemen at the front desk was a big help by logging into our account and printing the PDF out again. Another nice touch... each afternoon, we would find fresh lemonade waiting at the pool. The pool was very clean and quiet with lots of chairs and fresh towels laid out for the guests. There was an outdoor shower and a door that you could use to access the beach directly from the pool. THe only negative others might have (we stayed up late and weren't really bothered) was that the sports bar next door had music playing nightly that you could hear from the room. If this bothers you, consider asking the hotel to book you in one of the rooms away from the side street. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay at Ocean Park Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “We had our family reunion at Ocean Park...”
Reviews.Author: JenBru
Reviews.Content: We had our family reunion at Ocean Park Inn. Everything was amazing! The location is fantastic--the beach is right there & there are plenty of good places to eat within walking distance! The staff is extremely friendly & accomodating! Everything is kept very clean & tidy, including the lovely pool and hot tub!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to take in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: DinnerTimeFoodClub
Reviews.Content: Had the chance to stay at Ocean Park Inn for a weekend business meeting. Being a San Diego native I've done them all, but Ocean Park Inn was a great place to really enjoy San Diego and it's many beaches and great places to dine. Don't forget to watch out for the green flash at sunset! Definitely recommend for families and business stay with it being so close to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Made me feel like I was visiting friends that I hadn't seen in a while.”
Reviews.Author: steelers_fan69
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were greeted by David. He helped get us settled in our room and even suggested a mexican restaurant within walking distance of the hotel (which was wonderful). We had a room on the 2nd level with full ocean view... which was GORGEOUS. On our final night, Sachin gave us several suggestions of things to do and places to see. We barely scratched the surface and plan to return and stay @ OPI... They really made us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “This is the most amazing hotel in Pacific Beach, so much to offer!!!”
Reviews.Author: STLsweetheart314
Reviews.Content: My friends actually picked this hotel when we took a trip to Pacific Beach, and I have been in HUNDREDS of different hotels between martial arts competitions and for business. This is by far the coolest place I've stayed. The hotel is gorgeous, and you are right in the middle of all the action of Pacific Beach and 10-15 mins from everywhere else in San Diego. Perfectly central location with a gorgeous view of the PB beach and boardwalk. You are STEPS away from PB nightlife and great shops. The staff was energetic, wonderfully accommodating and knowledgeable of the activities that PB had to offer. I go San Diego often and I always stay in PB. This will forever be my hotel of choice without a doubt. I just can't wait to go again! HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: jltkc83
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and truly made my stay great. Great, family owned business!

Reviews.Title: “Great value on lively beach area, easy drive or scenic bike ride to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: montreal202
Reviews.Content: Hello fellow travellers ! I'm just back from a 3-night stay in late may 2010 at Ocean Park Inn, in lovely San Diego, Cal. VERY very pleased with location, convenience, staff and inn amenities. Pricing also competitive for all room with balcony with full or partial ocean view, while booked by internet. Cold breakfast very basic at the Inn. But the starbuck coffee shop and good supermarket steps away for Inn very convenient for personal supplements to eat at the Inn gated poolside patio or the room balcony ! Have fun in S.D. ! Then, come up to my home-city, Montreal Canada, for more fun French-canadian style. M.V. Montreal, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Park Inn made our vacation stay a relaxing pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: DickZ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had stayed a Ocean Park Inn several years ago but we were checking out other places on the beach. However, the several front desk people I talked with were so helpful and full of information. I called back several times to disuss pricing (I made reservations several months in advance of our stay), accomodations and amenities and each time I was more impressed with the front desk service and attention to detail. As a former purchasing agent I'm used to asking detailed questions, pushing for the best pricing, etc. Each person was helpful, informative and courteous. From the time we arrived until the time we left our stay was relaxed, the room quiet, the pool and spa clean and the staff friendly and helpful. The breakfast area had just been remodeled and we were told that the rooms would be updated next. The family ownership seems to be working very hard to be a restful vacation retreat. Richard

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Elliott_and_Lily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently flew out to San Diego for an anniversary trip, and we wanted to stay somewhere close to the water. Weâ€™re both originally from California, and we really miss the beach. A friend recommended the Ocean Park Inn, so we gave it a shot and went for the full ocean view. It did not disappoint. The view was absolutely amazing, and we spent a lot of our time just sitting on the roomy balcony looking out at the water and the people walking by on the boardwalk. The hotel could not be in a better locationâ€”there were so many restaurants to choose from that we often turned to the front desk staff for recommendations. They were incredibly helpful with everything we asked of them. Matt in particular was incredibly friendly, and we found ourselves stopping by the front desk just to chat with him. The rooms were clean and spacious, the continental breakfast was great, and the price was so great weâ€™re already planning our trip back. Iâ€™d highly recommend the Ocean Park Inn if youâ€™re looking for a friendly, clean hotel with an upbeat staff thatâ€™s just a few steps away from the sand!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: RascalAldean
Reviews.Content: My 2 friends and I stayed here for 5 days. Let's first say, when we checked in we were immediately upgraded at no cost to a partial ocean view room, when we only paid for a room with no room (saving us about $150). The view was amazing. The hotel was undergoing renevations during our stay which was a little unfortunate, but they always stayed out of our way and were no problem. The hot tub and pool were great, the complimentary breakfast was better than most, very nice staff. You are just steps away from a beautiful beach, the Pacific Ocean, $5 surf board rentals, several little shops, a CVS pharmacy, a 7/11, and more! Seriously, this is a pretty inexpensive hotel to stay at and very worth the money. I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value and a location that can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: empty002
Reviews.Content: This is the best location in San Diego. The sounds of the ocean can be heard from your room. Also, there is a ton to do in the beach area or you are a ten minute drive from most San Diego attractions. A friend of mine who is a local strongly suggested the PB area. We walked to lots of the bars and restaurants on Garnet. This is a big nightlife area. The Firehouse PB is also a neat place to go, as well at the PB Ale House and the PB Shore Club. We walked the boardwalk and enjoyed viewing the people going by from the hotel. Free internet is always awesome. The rooms are a good size and have all you could need, including a refrigerator and microwave. This was helpful because we often had some leftovers from eating out. The free breakfast is a nice bonus and included bagels, waffles, pastry, cereal, yogurt, coffee, etc. The parking isn't too high at $10. I also have to thank Pat and the other staff for their suggestions of where to eat and go for nightlife. He gave us some great information. I would recommend this hotel because it is a good hotel with a prime location at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in the heart of Pacific Beach. Amazing staff and great value.”
Reviews.Author: KKG1969
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. I'm super picky but also budget conscience. This us a great value. Awesome location. Amazing staff.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION! LOCATION! LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Lavendarbeach
Reviews.Content: Ocean Park Inn is a great place to stay with kids. The location is perfect. It is one of the few hotels actually on the beach. It is on the ocean side, not the bay side! We like to hear the waves. When we go to the beach, I like to stay at a hotel on the beach, not a block from the beach, but on the beach. The boardwalk is the only think separating you from the ocean. They have a nice pool and breakfast comes with the price of the room. The hotel itself is not super fancy, but it is clean and nice. The view from the ocean view rooms is spectacular!! There are good, affordable restaurants near the hotel, and a grocery store pretty close by. Also parking is expensive and hard to find at the beach. Ocean Park Inn is $10 a night, which is a great deal! For us Ocean Park Inn was the perfect hotel at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “As Good As Ever”
Reviews.Author: girlsinger68
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Ocean Park Inn when I travel to San Diego for at least 10 years, and it's as enjoyable now as ever. The recent renovations are great, the rooms are comfortable, & the views are spectacular. It's also steps away from some of the best food on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !!”
Reviews.Author: dqdale
Reviews.Content: We spent just two nights at the Ocean Park Inn - wish we could have stayed all week! The staff was great from the minute we entered the hotel. Lots of helpful info and very friendly. Loved the underground parking and the continental breakfast was wonderful. There was construction going on in the breakfast area but not a bother at all. It is a well-kept hotel and we could tell they really care about making it a great hotel. We will be anxious to see the final remodel job the next time we get to California. The location was just the best! Listened to the ocean waves from our room and loved the patio deck also. Loved the fact that it is totally a non-smoking hotel. We will definitely plan a return trip there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: stejacks
Reviews.Content: Walking distance of bars, restaurants, and shops. Hotel was doing some construction on the first floor during our stay. Did not hear a thing and it was quite contained. Pool was heated. Parking was not an issue. Park in their parking garage for a daily fee. Area around hotel consisted of a crowd in their mid 20's. Would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Tough to beat!”
Reviews.Author: JCM1492
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit and I can't think of another place in San Diego I'd rather stay. The hotel and staff are great and the rooms are very nice. The location is the clincher. We could watch the ocean waves and the interesting sidewalk strollers from our balcony. It is next to the beach and within walking distance of many restaurants and drinking establisments. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Christmas present ever!”
Reviews.Author: Soltera
Reviews.Content: We were so caught up in work and the holidays we decided to take a quick break and drive to San Diego to get away! As usual, the staff at Ocean Park was so welcoming! They always greet us by name and call once we are in our room to make sure everything is perfect. The weather was great. This is actually one of the best times to visit San Diego. Whale watching was so much fun and the quick drive up to Carlsbad to go to the outlets got us focused on Christmas gifts! We sat outside on our balcony to enjoy the sunset and the boardwalk. It is not crowded at all this time of year. Kona's coffee is always a favorite as is Filipili's on Garnet. We alway go across the way to the Firehouse and have at least drinks, if not dinner. We made it through Christmas, happy and relaxed and plan to make an early get away to Ocean Park every year at the same time. We miss you more and more every time we come home!

Reviews.Title: “40th Birthday trip with my twin sister was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Honeycombe69
Reviews.Content: Sachin and Patrick provided us with great customer service! They made me and my sister feel at home every hour we were there. They recommended great restaurants, gave us VIP tickets, and we had a blast being right on the ocean. Great location! The view was to die for each night. I cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value / Super Staff”
Reviews.Author: phaskins
Reviews.Content: First let me say that I'm a pretty laid back guy, so I wasn't too alarmed to find the hotel undergoing some remodeling when we arrived--some people might be put off. But our ground-floor room was great and the staff, Sachin in particular, was informative and helpfull even before we had arrived by doing some research on who rented standup paddle boards. Second, for a beach type vacation the value and location can't be beat whether surfing, swimming or just walking the boardwalk next to the beach. I'll be back for more sun and sand!

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: sandyv121
Reviews.Content: Ocean park Inn was a wonderful stay for us. The rooms were roomy, clean, well appointed and the staff was very helpful. We also took advantage of the complimentary breakfast which included toast, bagels, pastries, cereals and fresh fruits. The value wasn't what i would call exceptional at $200 dollars a night after taxes and parking were thrown in - but I think it was WELL worth it with the fantastic beachside location and the proximity to restaurants and nightlife. I would recommend HIGHLY requesting a room that does not face the Firehouse (a nightclub of sorts that is across the way) Its extremely loud but we upgraded to the partial oceanview and slept peacefully. They are still going through renovations but it did not hinder our enjoyment at the very least. I would absolutely return to this hotel and recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: BostonRae
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ocean Park Inn in 2008 and 2009. I walked up and down the boardwalk and I don't feel there is a better place to stay. I was on the 3rd floor with an ocean view each time. It is breathtaking at sunset. The hotel was in the process of upgrades during my last stay. My room had not been updated yet - it was in dire need of new bedding I will admit. The bed was quite uncomfortable. The TV was out dated - they were replacing them with wall mounted flat screens however. They were also painting all of the hallways - I see someone mentioned the hallways were not air conditioned - I don't spend time in the hallway, so I don't see why this would matter - I never noticed the hallways being uncomfortable. I used the pool area quite a bit to tan, and was usually the only one there. Pool area is great. I have read some reviews stating that the management and staff were rude, that the area is noisy, and there are people hanging around the hotel. I had absolutely no problems with any of the staff on either of my stays. Each one was consistently helpful, courteous - almost to a fault!, and friendly. Jay, Chanel, Patrick, Sachin and Karelia - made my stay all the more enjoyable. The hotel is on the Pacific Beach boardwalk - there is noise. There are people on the boardwalk, rollerblading, skateboarding, biking, walking and jogging from early morning to evening. The beach is also immediately off the boardwalk - what do people expect?!? For there to be no one on the beach and no one on the boardwalk? If you want quiet and solitude, stay on an island. It's Pacific Beach, it's a beach community - it is what it is. I never found the noise to be over-whelming and slept with my slider open every nite. Yes, there are a number of homeless that stay directly in front of the hotel on the boardwalk - they keep to themselves and don't bother anyone. I never saw them approach anyone at any time. They are gone by early evening. Traveling alone, I never felt afraid to be near them at any time-in fact I talked to some of them. They are harmless. T The continental breakfast changed last year and didn't offer as much as it did the year before (there were waffle makers the year before). However, there were several varieties of fresh bagels, packaged pastries, toast, butter, jelly's, cream cheese, fresh fruits, cereals, coffee, juice and milk. Just like any other continental breakfast FOR FREE. I'm just not sure what people expect. It was quite adequate. I would rather not have a full breakfast offered in lieu of keeping costs down. Again, having walked up and down the boardwalk, there are some really trashy places to stay - including the Best Western that are old, outdated, filthy and run down. Yes, there are a few nicer places like Tower 23 but the cost is also considerably higher. For the money, location, rooms and staff, I can't think of a better place to stay while in Pacific Beach or the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: traveller2332
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of the hotels at Pacific beach, and this was by far the best. The ocean view from our room was unparalleled. I could have spent our whole vacation sitting on the balcony. The staff was wonderful and quickly filled any needs we had and gave great advice for dining. So fast to the ocean- about a minute and you're there (from room to beach). I will definitely be back. Only down side was the continental breakfast- pretty meager boring pickings, but most continentals are.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location - comfortable rooms -”
Reviews.Author: snowbirdYuma
Reviews.Content: We brought our family to stay for 4 nights. The two bedroom suite is great for families. Decent view of the surf / lots of room / good beds / extra queen sofa bed / and a barely adequate kitchen (could use a better fridge). We also had a room with a king size bed. If you stay during holidays such as Spring Break be prepared for noise from the restaurants and clubs across the lane and on Grand. Lots of noise. Rooms facing Grand Avenue can be noisy until 1:00 AM. The more expensive rooms facing the ocean do not have this concern. The rooms are quite pricey but you have the most marvelous location on the beach. There is a nice pool and spa. They are just completing a number of renovations and upgrading. Lots of excellent restaurants within walking distance. We will be returning again. It is privately owned and there are NO deals to be had - you agree to the price quoted or find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We`ve been staying here almost 15 years- always return”
Reviews.Author: skyski55
Reviews.Content: We love the beach, My wife and I have stayed here as many as 6 times a year and have had our 2 kids with us before and after marriage with their spouses. It is the ideal place on the beach for view,culture,nightlife,and beach walking. They are just finishing a remodel that is a nice update. You can`t beat the view and food from Kono`s to Joes Crab Shack. The Firehouse right next door is newer and very nice w/ excellent food. Whether family,romance,friend etc the place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recomended”
Reviews.Author: ES24
Reviews.Content: Not happy with the noise and street people in front of the hotel. Management rude and not very helpful. While I appreciate the location on the boardwalk is charming, having the people camped in front of the hotel just did not justify the price. Look at other hotels down the way, I found several others without the problems, and management seemed much more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience not recommended”
Reviews.Author: wivesoforange
Reviews.Content: We came to San Diego for an athletic competion. I booked our room 3 weeks in advance with the hotel itself. Not at any time did the clerk that took the reservation point out, that on the weekend we were to stay, was a yearly festival on the boardwalk and a soundstage with live music direclty next to the hotel. We arrrived on Friday the halls had a funny smell the couch in the room was disgusting and you had to put a towel over it ,in order to sit. The room had a great view however you could not go outside on to the balcony on saturday due to the blarring music and noise from the boardwalk. After the music stopped the clean up and breakdown of the tents began. The doors and draperies were closed and the noise was still unbearable. After being in a competion all of saturday with a second day to follow we needed to sleep which was impossible. The people at the front desk were nice the Assistant Manager has an attitude.I will never stay in this hotel again or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Directly on the beach - amazing view”
Reviews.Author: InItinere
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located directly on the Promenade on Pacific Beach, which means you just need to step out of your room to be on the beach. We had a room with partial ocean view - strongly recommended! We had the swimming pool below our room, and then the ocean at a (short) distance. The room was pretty large and comfy. Breakfast and Internet access was included. The staff was also very helpful in assisting us with our trip planning. Overall, our stay at this hotel was a highly positive experience!

Reviews.Title: “Read this first”
Reviews.Author: Donna81Us
Reviews.Content: Was hesitant about this hotel after reading some of the reviews and my fears came to life as soon as we checked in. We had a room on the first floor with a kitchenette which smelled awful - evidently a souvenier from the last meal cooked there. The hotel is very outdated. I was told by the very nice desk clerk (who took me around the hotel attempting to find us another room) that they are in the process of updating???? Not to sure about that. Hotel is right on the strand. There is no A/C in the hallways and it appears that windows are usually kept open. We were supposed to stay two nights but left after one. Probably a great place for families on a budget with small children. Oh yeah, continental breakfast is juice boxes and poptarts basically. It is a good location though.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KaptainKool
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay and second review of this hotel. the first was 2007. we have stayed at nicer hotels but this has turned in to be our favorite place. it doesnt have plush rooms or turn down service. u dont get a mint on ur pillow. however, u will get a relaxing and enjoyable stay on the beach. It is right on the beach overlooking the boardwalk. the rooms are in need of updating and remodeling but you can NOT beat the view. Watching the sunsets over the ocean doesnt get any better than So-Cal. The staff was helpful and freindly. the breakfast was free. no frills. but the room has a fridge and theres a grocery store across the street. Ocean Beach and San diego has a ban on alcohol on the beach. it wouldve been nice to have a beer and sit on the beach but there are plenty of bars on the boardwalk. we stayed for four nights this time from sunday - thursday. it is so laid back there we will go again. we always have in-n-out burgers and su casa mexican restaurant in la jolla but we fell in love with wahoos fish tacos in point loma. Cant wait for our return.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for and right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Tennessee-diver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I normally stay away from busy beach areas but the Ocean Park Inn made it easy. It is located right on the boardwalk and right on the beach in Pacific Beach. The rooms are large and comfortable and clean. We were concerned about the noise and the crowds but it just has not been an issue. We have our dbalcony door open as we speak with the roar of the waves in the background muffling any other noises. People are exceptionally friendly and the beach is big enough to absorb any crowded feeling. The staff has been great. They gave wonderful recommendations on a variety of things, and went out of their way to take care of a few minor requests. There are a number of great restaurants within easy walking distance, along with a Starbucks and full grocery store right across the street. It is also centrally located to most major attractions in the San Diego area. Our favorite part of our vacation has been to get up early in the morning , take our Starbucks coffee out to the beach and do our morning meditation. Then we take our boogie boards out and ride the waves, do a little sight seeing and come back for a wonderful view of the sunset. It has been a great vacation so far and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING! Read this before staying here”
Reviews.Author: Amerc87
Reviews.Content: I got a room here for one night to celebrate my birthday. I payed pretty close to $400 for it which was totally not worth it. But I wanted to be close to the nightlife in the area. Myself and three other friends stayed the night in the room. All in all it could have been worth it, except a week after staying there i noticed on my credit card statement they had charged me $250. When I contacted them to ask what the charge was about, they said they had found cigarette ashes on the balcony the next day while cleaning and they had photographic evidence. The staff was rude and uncooperative when I explained that nobody that was in the room is a smoker. So i asked for a copy of the pictures. One woman i spoke with agreed to send them via e-mail. But when i spoke to her manager a minute later the manager said that they photos werent taken with a digital camera and they wouldn't pay for the film to be developed. Then she proceeds to tell me that there were ashes all over the carpet in the room and it smelled heavily of smoke. All of this are blatant lies. This place is a total SCAM!!! It's ridiculous and I feel taken advantage of after paying such an insane amount for a crappy hotel room. NEVER stay here. You can get the same kind of room a few blocks away for way cheaper. And probably a much friendlier staff.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but great location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: LondonJess_73
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Ocean Park Inn is the location. Its right on the beach in the heart of PB and all the shops, bars and restaurants. Its also got a small but nice pool which is a rarity in the area. The downside is that hotel is very basic and in need of modernisation - it all looks a bit past its best, it even smells musty. The rooms are clean but desperately out of date with wallpaper in the rooms and bathrooms that would better suit a retirement home. And your stay will be effected by the other guests. If you're next to a quiet couple who keep decent hours you'll sleep like a baby - the beds are very comfortable. But, if like us, a group of teens move in opposite and upstairs and come in and out all night - you will notice. TIP - ask for a room on the top floor - the ceilings are not sound proofed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect fit for a long weekend vacation”
Reviews.Author: Minnesota2009
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I traveled to San Diego for a vacation over a long weekend in June. We did a lot of research prior to the vacation to find a hotel that would fit our needs of location, moderate cost, pool, free breakfast, and overall value. I was having a very difficult time finding a hotel under $250/night that had decent reviews and had the important amenities we were looking for (e.g. accessible to restaurants, pool, breakfast). We were very pleased with our choice of the Ocean Park Inn and glad that we positioned our vacation in Pacific Beach. Prior to booking a room, I called the front desk to ask about the difference types of rooms and which rooms were affected by the neighboring bar's noise (from prior reviews). We booked a limited view king-bed room on the hotel website because it was the best value in our opinion (compared to the slightly more expensive partial view and most expensive ocean view); the front desk let us check out a partial view room when we arrived in case we wanted to upgrade. We stayed with our limited view room because it had better light / larger sliding glass door and was conveniently on the ground floor so we could walk right out to the hotel pool every day. There are partitions between the rooms and the pool, so we didn't feel that there was less privacy from facing the pool on the ground floor. If any rooms have less privacy it would be the ocean front rooms because the hotel is only a few feet off the boardwalk. But the views of the ocean surf are fantastic! We walked out to the Crystal Pier for amazing sunsets when we weren't enjoying the sunset at a boardwalk restaurant. The room was clean and updated, slightly unexpected after reading prior posts, with the exception of the outdated light teal bathroom (but it was very spacious and clean so we didn't mind). Our king bed was comfortable (and huge!), we had a mini-fridge to stock beer and snacks for pool time, and we were happy with the very convenient location right on the boardwalk and within walking distance of many restaurants along the Pacific Beach area. Our room had a loveseat, small closet, wardrobe, and a desk. We rented a car for our vacation so that we could explore other neighborhoods every morning until the sun came out around noon every day. Parking was very reasonable ($10) whereas it seems that every other hotel in the San Diego area charged $30/day! We enjoyed being able to drive straight down Garnet Ave (only a block or two north of Grand Ave) to Trader Joe's for getting beer, wine, and snacks. We were able to look up restaurants, directions, and lots of info on their FREE wireless internet connection, which was great and rare! Bring your laptop! The front desk was very helpful, in allowing us to ensure we had chosen the best room for us, recommending restaurants and other helpful suggestions. Jay, especially, was very friendly and helpful. After reading reviews that the front desk was staffed by teenage kids that didn't care about their customers, this was a relief. Breakfast was a little spare, but they had cereal, bagels, juice, yogurt, and (cheap) coffee. We were expecting the Belgian waffle maker previously mentioned or at least something with a little protein, so it was disappointing, but free. There was a family there telling us about all the great breakfast fare (eggs, waffles) they enjoyed during their stay there a few months earlier, so I know they have the ability to provide a more satisfying breakfast! It was apparently not busy enough that weekend to provide their superior breakfast foods. All-in-all, this was a great choice for us. Pros: free wireless internet! free breakfast until 10am, enclosed outdoor pool (for wind protection), right on boardwalk, clean/bright rooms and good value, unlimited towels for pool/beach, affordable private parking, friendly employees, and great location in Pacific Beach neighborhood to ocean and nearby restaurants (see other TripAdvisor reviews: try the Green Flash and the Fishery, avoid Gringos Cantina)... Cons: breakfast a little minimal, hot tub turns off at 10pm, can be noisy but only if in a room facing bar behind the hotel (ask front desk), no onsite restaurant but they offer room service from the neighboring bar & grill (Firehouse?)...

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: rewyanc
Reviews.Content: THis place is in a goiod location if you want to be on the boardwalk and next to the beach. But its also located less than 20 feet from a very hip and loud nightclub. At night there are drunk kids roaming around outside till 3 or 4 in the morning. the hotel is definately in need of some updating as well. Overall it wasn't a bad experience, but if you are loooking for a nice quiet place to stay on the ocean this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel on Pacific Beach!”
Reviews.Author: SoxSweepYanks2009
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeklong stay in San Diego. Originally we were at the Hilton downtown, but it was so impersonal and cold. Early on we walked by the Ocean Park Inn and on a lark asked about room rates & availability. This hotel is directly on the beach and at the end of the PB where all the cool restaurants and bars are - all within easy walking distance. The staff was so friendly - always saying hello when you came in, offering suggestions for restaurants, etc. The rates were about $70/night less than what we were paying at the Hilton, parking was nominal, there was a heated pool and free breakfast included. We were so glad to have stumbled across this location and would stay there again in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and it's fab location”
Reviews.Author: F_f_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed in family room with 5 friends. Beautiful views from balcony. Great pool and the hotel is as close to the beach as you can get! The staff in the hotel were really friendly and helped us out alot. Great hotel, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a beachfront vacation!”
Reviews.Author: jcollision
Reviews.Content: We booked the Ocean Park Inn after a lot of research and were very pleased with our visit. The hotel is located in a prime beachfront location. We requested and received a third floor ocean view room. Our room was very clean and spacious, with an excellent view of the boardwalk and beach. The hotel overall was well-kept and the staff was very courteous. The complementary breakfast was nothing special, but it was adequate. Some helpful things to know: 1. Request an ocean view room - especially if you want quiet. The back side of the hotel faces a lively night spot - the Firehouse. The music was loud, but the fish tacos and the rooftop dining were wonderful! 2. We booked our reservation directly on the Hotel's website. They offered an online promotion that beat any other rate we could find. 3. Parking is $10 per night and very tight. Not a problem at this time of year, but could be difficult in a busier season. 3. There is a very nice grocery across the street and many good restaurants in easy walking distance. 4. Coronado, Balboa Park, and the Gaslamp District are all well worth a visit. We only wish we'd had more time!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location Right on the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: 2moretravelers
Reviews.Content: This is a really great place to stay if you'd like to have an ocean view balcony right off the boardwalk. I stayed with 2 friends for a weekend getaway and we enjoyed our stay. The hotel staff was very helpful and actually took extra time to give us local information and good spots the locals like to go too. We booked a balcony room and it was one with the direct view of the ocean...fabulous!!! We were able to enjoy the sound of the waves and see the beautiful sunsets. The hotel has a deluxe free breakfast and it was actually quite tasty. There is fresh fruit a waffle maker and many other breakfast goodies. They also have 24hr coffee and juices at no charge in the lobby as well as a coffeemaker in the rooms. Overall the hotel stay was very enjoyable the room was clean and in a great location. The hotel is a bit dated but not enough to change my option of our stay. The one thing I will say that was a bit of a problem is the parking. There is a $10.00 a day charge and the parking garage is rather tight and if you are there during high season it may be difficult to get a spot. The parking is ONLY for the guest so there should be enough for everyone but some of the cars were parked in 2 spaces so it was tight. Oh yes, and they have an outside hottub and great pool. We would stay again and really enjoyed the hotel, breakfast, hottub, pool and espeicallly the location!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: guitargirrl
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay if you love the ocean, cool people and are into a laid back atmosphere. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The location was great. Right on the beach, literally, right on the beach. Get the ocean view room, its so worth it. We sat on our private terrace and watched the surf roll in every morning. Great resturants close by, the Firehouse, wonderful fish tacos! If you want a hearty breakfast you have to check out Kona's, a short walk from the hotel. It's super inexpensive but extremely good! People were lined up out the door to order. I suggest renting a car if you're flying in. The folks from Enterprise Rentals are great. They came to the hotel and picked us up. Very helpful. I just can't say enough good things about the Ocean Park Inn and the staff. For the price you can't beat it! A special THANK YOU to Patrick, the guy who checked us in. You rock! Do yourself a favor and stay at the Ocean Park Inn. You'll love it, I know we did!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: kristinehanna
Reviews.Content: This is a place to stay if you want to be close to the boardwalk, the action, the beach and the college students. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is low key. We were kept awake for most of the first night by the homeless people who live right in front of the hotel on the boardwalk, so there is lots of color. This is NOT the place to stay if you want luxury, a big room and some peace and quiet. The pool is not that great and the complimentary breakfast is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Travel7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely amazing! We stayed here for 6 nights and every one of them was great. The view from the room is the best part and leaving the balcony door open to hear the ocean waves at night was even better. It was so convenient to be able to just walk out of our hotel and be right on the beach. It was also nice to be able to sit outside on our balcony. Although the balcony and room was small, the view definitely made up for it. We didn't need anything more than what we had. Our room had a nice size bathroom and a refrigerator and microwave. The breakfast was great every morning and the hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The area is definitely geared towards the younger crowd and has some great restaurants and bars. There are numerous places to eat and drink steps away from the hotel so you shouldn't have any problem finding a place to go! Also, there is a grocery store right across the street. Pacific Beach is a good location if you are planning on visiting Sea World, The Zoo, La Jolla, and many other places because each is only a short drive away. The area also seemed to be fairly safe and the rooms even safer. If you're going to stay in San Diego, this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Beach front view”
Reviews.Author: lndmrgn
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our anniversary and wanted to hear the sounds of the ocean. Hubby likes to research all aspects and chose this one. It would not have been my first choice. Yes, it is definitely ocean front and you can hear the waves at night but I wasn't too keen on the area. It is where all the college kids hang out. Not very romantic. It was a bit pricey even at this time of year. There were several bars but not many good restaurants. If you like this atmosphere, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Hooboox
Reviews.Content: The reviews I read scared us a little before, but to stay at this hotel was the best choice of our holiday! We asked for a silent room after having read the reviews and our room really was very silent. The staff was very very friendly and helpful. Location is great and the pool and hot tub provide a nice place to stay during the day. There are numerous (low budget, but nice) restaurants around. I can imagine the Firehouse bar next door can get loud for the rooms on the south/east side, but we did not hear a thing. We really recommend this place! It was well worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ocean Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: lam269
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocean Park inn this last week (Oct. 20th) and I was skeptical after reading some reviews. We were pleasantly suprised by the AMAZING location. The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a little dated, but had a long counter for all of our "bathroom stuff" We had a fabulous view of the ocean, and our room was nice and quiet at night. The staff was very pleasant and helpful, and aimed to please. There was alot of restaurants, sportsbars and shops within walking distance. All in all, I would definately reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: KarenintheBay
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2nd floor ocean view balcony room. The view was absolutely fantastic and we loved sitting on the balcony watching the sunset and sunrise. Fell asleep with the door open to hear the waves. Rates includes breakfast which we ate sitting on the balcony. Big and clean room. Very good location right on the boardwalk. Nice to be able to just get out the door and walk to the bars, cafes, shops, etc. It is right next to a trendy restaurant/lounge with a rooftop bar (note: plays loud music, but didn't bother us as we were out late and our room faced the other way). For the price we paid it was an extremely good value. Would especially recommend for young travelers because of the good party location.

Reviews.Title: “I'd recommend the Ocean Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: Lindak1221
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on Pacific Beach and right on the boardwalk with lots of people walking, biking, running by. Very busy location. That means there's a lot to see and do here. It's less than a block to the supermarket and Starbucks and restaurants. If you want to walk/run on the beach or watch the ocean and surfers right from your balcony, it's great. The room was a little shabby, but large, and the bathroom needs updating but the location is great. There was a small refrig and microwave. Get an upper floor for a better view. They have underground parking so no worries about parking or safety, and a hearty breakfast is included. When we were there, it was windy and cold so we didn't use the pool or whirlpool. Great beach walking and people watching and close to the pier.

Reviews.Title: “Will be Back !!!!”
Reviews.Author: tc032851
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about the staff & hotel, my nephew flew in 5 hrs before us and they gave him towels for the pool and let him do his laundry that was wet due to a broken bottle in his suitcase.Always went the extra in trying to find us places to eat and sites to see. They let us have our birthday party for my 3yr old nephew in the lounge & even had the lights out for the birthday cake !!!! Like I said we will be back next August.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, if you can tolerate the smell”
Reviews.Author: kjmeister
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at hotels right next to beaches on occasion. I've found them to be hit or miss. For a beachfront inn, this is a respectable place. My brother and I stayed in a corner room that did not face the beach directly. The smallish patios were angled, with one side facing the beach. This meant you look down other people's patios when you view the ocean. The bathrooms were in good shape, and the beds were firm but comfortable. Also, the continental breakfast is quite reasonable. The garage is located under the inn. I would say the price is somewhat high if just staying overnight. Never got a chance to go into the pool as it was cool out, but I can say it was on the small side (but, hey, this is a beach inn we're talking about.) Two gripes: First, you have to get use to the strange cleaning smell that reeks through hotel. The smell carries into the room, though not as potent. Second, they've had some electrical rework recently... the bed lights had no switch! The desk was courteous enough to provide an extra table lamp, but it seemed awfully weird this fundamental problem was never fixed to begin with. In short, the problems are not critical, but the problems are obvious enough that I would not give this hotel the highest rating. 3 out of 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous View”
Reviews.Author: ohiotravelerabc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this oceanfront property August 9-11, 2008 and really enjoyed our stay there. We arrived well before check-in time and the staff was very accommodating. Ask for a balcony room on the 2nd or 3rd floors for the best views of the ocean. There is only a large boardwalk between the ocean and the hotel so there is a fabulous view. Our room was spacious and included a sofa. The hotel provided a wonderful continental breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 12Jim
Reviews.Content: Great lacation. Great experience. Our only complaint is the hallways etc. are very warm.

Reviews.Title: “Walkable”
Reviews.Author: landloper
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on Pacific Beach. The Strand, the pier, restaurants and shops are all right there or within a block or two. Walking was a pleasure in San Diegoâ€™s fantastic weather, especially at this hotelâ€™s location on the coast. I found two car rental companies nearby with hotel pick-up but we didnâ€™t need them. Instead, we took advantage of the bus stops one or two blocks away for travel to attractions around town. The room was clean and comfortable. The desk and free wi-fi were handy when I used the public transportation Trip Planner on the SDMTS website. We slept with the balcony door open to get the ocean breeze and the soft soothing sound of the waves. The complimentary breakfast has ample choices. I recommend trying the self-serve waffle maker. We remedied the lack of fruit with a two-block walk to the local supermarket, storing the perishables in our hotel roomâ€™s refrigerator. The staff at the desk were always there and ready to be helpful, a plus since this was my first time in San Diego. Their three-day-advance cancellation policy took some improvising since our arrival date was uncertain.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: lec510
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews we decided to book ahead and ask for an ocean facing room on the 3rd floor. We were greeted by a friendly front desk and were able to check in at noon, which was a bonus. The view from the balcony was awesome! If you love the ocean and like to people watch, this is your hotel. The room was more than we expected. We had a king size bed, and the room was still big enough to include a desk and love seat. Although the bathroom was dated (peach toilet), the room certainly wasn't shabby. The entire hotel is non-smoking and smells very clean. The continental breakfast is miles above the usual ancient danish and coffee. Fresh pastries, hard boiled eggs, waffles, and fruit were in abundance every morning! Last but not least, the location of the hotel couldn't be better. Steps from the beach, right in the thick of Pacific Beach restaurants and bars. We will definitely stay here next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: farmphil
Reviews.Content: The wife and I had a wonderful stay. Extremely clean room with all we needed. Friendly help Best part is right on the beach with San Diego culture all around. We will go back when we go to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Hate2travel
Reviews.Content: Dates: May 2-5 Best location Very clean and well maintained daily Great continental breakfast Super staff Pay extra for the ocean view Great underground parking-$10 daily Wouldn't change a thing! We'd go back in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “A little of column A, A little of Column B”
Reviews.Author: Bovi33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, and is in an excellent location. The rooms are completely adequate, of normal size and wear. The staff is a nightmare - its a bunch of college kids who don't care. We would wait at the desk while they were talking and joking amongst themselves. They are extremely unhelpful. This hotel also has no food/beverage in house, although there area many area restaurants etc. People from the front desk came and screamed at everyone in the pool a couple of times because of noise. I didn't even think anyone was being too noisy. Only plus of this hotel is the location - on pacific beach surrounding the amazing nightlife there.. cabs available to take you anywhere else in San Diego..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, PERFECT location!!! (from Rochester, NY)”
Reviews.Author: ShannonBRochester
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here over Labor Day weekend last year 2007 and had the best time! I flew in from Rochester,NY and met him here (he was working in San Bernardino at the time). We stayed in an oceanview room that was just steps from the ocean. It's a great location if you like to be active and run/bike/rollerblade along the boardwalk. Also we walked everywhere...great restaurants and shops all over. Perfect distance for a quick car ride to La Jolla, Cornado and Mission Bay (gotta go jet skiing...so fun!). The staff was very friendly and the room was very clean! The only negative about this place was the cramped parking garage (what can you do?) that my boyfriend backed into a cement barrier in. oops! We had fun anyway! Definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Southern California”
Reviews.Author: Conk99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been coming to the Ocean Park Inn three or four times a year for 15 years. There are very few places in Southern California other than the OPI that you can stay right on the beach (not the bay or harbor) and be so close to hear the waves crashing. The price is half of what I pay at Shutters or the Lowes in Santa Monica and even though they are considered beach front hotels the walk to the water is about 300 yards. The rooms are becoming a little outdated however they are still clean and larger than the rooms you see in a Westin or Sheraton. The location is a perfect walk to many shops, bars, and cafes. When I read some of the reviews I am suprised, try the Best Western Blue Sea Lodge or the Surfer Beach Hotel if you want an undesireable experience. Ocean Park has my vote and will continue to have my vote.

Reviews.Title: “Warning about the bar music next door to the hotel!.....”
Reviews.Author: roadtrip1000
Reviews.Content: The GOOD: The location of the hotel was great and parking was reasonable (I think we paid $10 per night). The hotel sits a few feet away from the ocean and is close to many attractions, and restaurants. The staff was friendly, the room was clean, and the free breakfast selection was good (bread, waffles, cereal, yogurt.. but no FRUIT - luckily there's a grocery store around the corner with tons of fresh ready -cut- fruit to take with you and have with your breakfast). The BAD: Unfortunately, we had a room facing the Firestation bar (I think that's the name) directly next door to the hotel. The music was SO loud and people were partying and screaming until 2 or 3am. It sounded like it was right outside our window. There was NO way to sleep through the night. We found out the following night that ONLY the rooms facing this bar get the interruption. So if you're staying there, opt for a room away from that section and get a quiet sleep. The UGLY: I called the front desk at midnight to ask when the music would stop - they said 1:30 am. It went later than this. The hotel did not offer me to switch rooms and I didn't think to ask since I assumed all the rooms had this noise level from the bar. After discovering that we could have had a better room location, I asked the hotel manager for a discount and said I'd love to stay there again as long as I got a better room location. She said she'd get back to me. I have not heard back and until am disappointed with this lack in customer service. Besides the music blaring, the hotel was great and I'd recommend it to others.. just ask ahead of time for a room facing AWAY from the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Awful Service”
Reviews.Author: cbarceloux
Reviews.Content: The location is good, but the staff is rude and unhelpful. The place smells and the rooms are dirty. The breakfast is free, but for a good reason!!! They also harass guests if you dont check out in time and have a rediculous non smoking policy that is enforeced after you check out. Be carefull you might get a surprise on your Credit Card Statement.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect, cute hotel that could use a little attention”
Reviews.Author: toddinparis
Reviews.Content: Overall, I strongly recommend this hotel. The location is fantastic, and the exterior is the best presentation in Pacific Beach (this area of San Diego). The "boardwalk" in front of the hotel is very nice and clean (except for occasional transients sleeping on the city sidewalk, no worries - plenty of police patrols around). The daily continental breakfast was a big plus - very clean presentation. The beds are very comfortable, the shower had nice flow. But I can't give it the perfect "5" due to a few things: the interior is showing signs of wear with peeling, loud wallpaper in the bathrooms; the hotel staff is a nice bunch of young kids, but a little too informal and untrained; the pool is in the shadow of the building, so it's cold and uninviting; we had problems connecting to the "free" WiFi in the lobby; parking is an additonal $10/day; and our "oceanfront" room had a view blocked by a palm tree (this only occurs in room 305). I still think this is the best deal in this area, and we would definitely come back here because it was a good deal. Try to stay on the top (3rd) floor, as it provides the best views. The first floor views are blocked by garden walls and wind-screens, so it's hardly "oceanview". Definitely do not stay on the back of the building due to a very loud nightclub across the alley.

Reviews.Title: “Great off-season visit”
Reviews.Author: GailorJ54
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our visit. We had an ocean-view room that was on the 2nd floor. The hotel is U-shaped and we were as far from the elevator as one could be. Our room and bath were clean and comfortable. We had an awesome view of the beach area. The continental breakfast had a nice variety of pasteries, cereal, toast, bagels, fresh fruit, and hard boiled eggs, or you could make your own waffle. The attendant kept the area clean and stocked. My only complaints were that the hallway had a very stale odor that probably a carpet shampooing would cure and the only internet access in the hotel was in the lobby/breakfast area if you had a wireless laptop. We did see several homeless men on the boardwalk, but only during the day, and none of them ever approached us. We liked being within walking distance of a variety of restaurants and didn't have a bad meal at any of them. There were several shops in the area, and we were 15-20 minutes from Sea World, the Zoo, and the airport. If we should decide to visit this area again, I would not hesitate to stay at the Ocean Park Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TJB3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my husband and I. I would go back and bring my children as well. They don't need much for entertainment when you have a beach so close by. Service was friendly and always available. Wonderful breakfast bar offered till 10am! The rooms are clean and comfortable - not luxury - but very nice - TV (if you really want to be inside!) we never turned ours on; refridgerator for you to fill (there is a grocery store and 7 Eleven within one block of hotel); ironing board, hair dryer - the basics. Everything was in working order and did I mention CLEAN! Air conditioner worked well! Parking garage was perfect, handy for the busy location and convenient/safe as it is locked and accessible ONLY to hotel guests. Many good local restaurants within walking distance. Lots of local and visitor walking/bike/skateboard traffic. We were there over Labor Day weekend and had a room facing the beach. We were worried that it would be really noisy but it wasn't at all! We walked everywhere - grocery, dining, beach, dancing and a bit of shopping. Very close to airport and not far to get to downtown. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Review of Hotel & Area”
Reviews.Author: melody847
Reviews.Content: I was not sure how to rate this hotel. The only fair way would be to split the review of the hotel from the area. Some of the problems my family(hubby and 2 teens) encountered were not the fault of the hotel. Yet the area is usually how most choose their hotel. The Ocean Park Inn: Even though I made reservations 6 months in advance they were not able to accomodate us in the same room for a week. The first 2 nights we stayed in a 2 room suite that overlooked their very nice and warm pool. This room had a large balcony(could fit 4 chairs) and a nice small view of the ocean. You could hear the ocean if you kept your patio door/windows open at night. The room was clean, decorated nicely and had a full size table and kitchenette. We really liked this room and pleaded with them to let us stay in it even though we would be giving up the full oceanview. It was perfect for the 4 of us. My teens could stay up later since it had a TV in the living/kitchen area and also one in the bedroom. Since they do assign rooms at the time of reservation we had to move to our 1 room oceanview room. This room was very spacious but not nearly as nice. It needed updating and the bathroom was in desparate need of caulking. The patio screen door was broke but they did fix it immediately when I called. The balcony was very small and could only hold 2 small chairs. This was the kind of room that even when cleaned(which they did a great job on) did not look like it because it was old and needed work. Showers in both rooms had excellent water pressure. We found the staff very pleasant and helpful. The continental breakfast was fabulous. Waffles, eggs, variety of cereals and the best cinnamon rolls and other pastries. I grade a continental breakfast on the serving of some kind of protein and they got an A+. Parking in their garage was an issue. We had rented a small SUV and most parking spots were for compact cars only. We had a very difficult time parking our car, often having to take up 2 compact spots, which everyone was having to do, which resulted in less spots. Also, if you came in late at night-forget about it. With updating and their doing work in the rooms, this hotel could be a 4* hotel. Our first room was great, our 2nd was not. Pacific Beach: The beach area and boardwalk were not clean. When asked, I was told they clean every Friday. Once a week is not enough with the amount of people in the area. Water temp was great@74degrees. However, we did not like the amount of seaweed that would wrap around you when playing in the waves. My teens loved the surf area which is separate from the swim area. The Pacifc Beach Surf Shop across from the hotel is the place to go for lessons and rentals. Gave us a discount since both kids got lessons and even gave us a 2 for 1 rental on skateboards. This is not an area for kids. I was not happy that my 2 teens were exposed to an area of heavy drinking. Open street bars everywhere and many adults were walking around that obviously had too much to drink. The bars were filled to capacity(seen as walking down the boardwalk) even during the day. Average age in the twenties. Felt we could put up with during the day but not good at night. I disagree with the previous reviewer, the area by this hotel is crowded. There were police patrolling and they were kept busy. Every night at least one big fight in the area. Usually over a girl. We read on this site about the homeless and were prepared. They sleep out on the benches on the boardwalk directly across from the oceanview rooms. Most are quiet but not always. I called the front desk at 5am one morning because of all the noise. They did send a security person out to ask the homeless to leave the area, which they did. The boardwalk is very busy, at least in August, with a lot of noise and partying crowds walking by until about 1-2am. For this reason, I cannot recommend this hotel to families, unless they reserved a room in the back of the hotel and off the boardwalk. We did not have any of these problems with our first room we had that was back by the pool. As you can see, this was a difficult review. Maybe a month other than August would be different. See my San Diego Crowds review. We liked having a Ralphs grocer, 7Eleven and numerous restaurants nearby. Just north of our hotel was Tower 23 and Pacific Terrace Hotel, both much quieter but a lot more expensive. A few blocks south was the Best Western, more in the mission beach area which is quieter. All are directly on the beach and boardwalk. The Pacific was on a bluff and had a lot of stairs to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: k-ro99
Reviews.Content: Stayed from June 19-21. I made the reservations with a little trepidation as Tripadvisor reviewers seemed to either rant about the hotel or rave about it. We had a very pleasurable stay. We had a 3rd floor, ocean front room with king bed & pull-out sofa, refrigerator, and microwave. We arrived early on the 21st, and OPI accommodated us by getting us in the room by 12:00. They also allowed us to keep our car parked in the garage until 3:00 on our day of departure so we could enjoy more beach time. The room was a basic hotel room but everything was functional, clean, and in good condition. While we were there, they were painting the exterior - can be a pain to deal with maintenance like this when a guest; however, the workers were circumspect, and I'm always pleased to see hotels invest in their properties, instead of just milk profits out of it. The balcony off the room was very tiny, but sufficient to sit and enjoy a morning coffee or evening wine. The sound of the ocean from the room is lovely. The continental breakfast is a little basic - definitely room for improvement. However, when we were there, the staff was getting instructions on a waffle machine, so there may be upgrades coming there! Across the cul-de-sac street from the hotel was a small shop called Pacific Beach Surf Shop. They have a larger shop a block down in same complex as Hooters. Danny at the Grand Ave shop was awesome - very helpful to my son, who signed up for surf lessons. We enjoyed meals at Nicks and Green Flash (strong drinks!) One comment I'd make is that most of the boardwalk along this area are residences (small condos/hotels). I was expecting more shopping along the boardwalk than there was. I wasn't disappointed - I think it made for a quieter, more kid-friendly experience - however, it was unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with reservation.”
